Reviews.Title: “replaced munich by istanbul,and there was inter hotel.”
Reviews.Author: andipanda
Reviews.Content: my point of wiew is about price/quality and the answer is yes.this is for booking directly to the hotel site,which is a must at istanbul hotels.75 eur/twin-10%cash discount,free airport-hotel,20 eur retour,good basic breakfast,Beyazit tram T1 station close.(with T1 you go everywhere).change your money in this area,evening is better.try to go one day for shopping to Viaport outlet.take the seabus Kabatas-Bostanci on Asian side(25 min) there is a free shuttle to Viaport(35 min) and you will see a complete different Istanbul.next time(end of October)i will try a hotel between Cemberlitas and Gulhane tram stops.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction relies on price & location”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: This hotel wins on price and locations. Its minutes from the Grand Bazaar, about 15 mins from the Blue Mosque and from the Bosphorus. And I only paid â‚¬45 per room. So good value and location and free wifi.. But surely to get some of the great reviews here, it needs something more...nothing wrong with it, but okay doesn't make for "wonderful" in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - be prepared for the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: BitErik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a very good location, 3 minutes walk from Grand Bazaar, 10 minutes walk from Blue Mosque. Staff is nice and helpful but sometimes too busy. We were there with a stroller and realized that the elevator stops at half floors, so you have to climb either down or up to get to your room. Definitely not suitable for persons unable to climb stairs at least twice a day. Some additional notes: * If you book 3 nights on their homepage, you'll get free airport transfer to/from Ataturk. (We booked elsewhere but got a free transfer to the airport.) * The room wasn't big but was acceptable for a week with two small children. * Breakfast is free and quite basic - and the menu is the same every day. If you're on a budget, it's ok. If not, you will probably go out and buy some cakes or anything else after the second day. * Bathroom is really clean. * If we go with the airport shuttle next time, we'll ask it for half an hour earlier, based on lessons learned :) Yes, there'll be a next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mooz110
Reviews.Content: My family stay for 4 nights from 1st April to 5th April Was very pleasant. They picked me up on time at the airport and welcomed With a chocolate basket complimentary The hotel and rooms are very clean and the staff are wonderful and helpful One morning we were late for breakfast and the eggs had finished And they made fresh for me in 3 mins They also have free wifi I love the location as it is walking distance 2 mins to grand bazaar. I recommend this hotel, already my relatives and friends also stayed in may 2011 and they loved it to and another friend is booked to go April 2012

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: thiakx
Reviews.Content: With a short 5minutes walk from the main street and a few tram stops down from the main attractions, this hotel is good value for money. Hotel even guide us to the correct bus service to bring us to our next destination, a much appreciated gesture.

Reviews.Title: “hotel inter”
Reviews.Author: amin c
Reviews.Content: we arrived 26th dec and were picked up at the airport. the flight was late and there were loads of ques but they still waited for us until we came out. The hotel was nice - the only problem was i have 3 kids all under 6 and we had a pram - to get to the main road it is difficult to push the pram up the hill , this is not the hotels fault of course. The rooms were clean and nice, cleaned everyday Breakfast was nice they gave us a lift back to the airport for a charge of 18 euros which is the going rate in istanbul. The drinks in the hotel were cheap - hotels usually rip you off but not this one - i paid 2 lira for 1 tea and 2 bottles of water - also when i needed hot water for our baby , they gave us that free thanks to everyone at hotel and im sorry if my kids caused you any bother amin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: emira e
Reviews.Content: The staff are very considerate and helpful. The pickup service from and to the airport was really useful, the rooms were quiet (I stayed there during the New Years Eve with a small baby, and everything was silent). I used the 10 percent discount offer by paying cash uprofnt. The airport pickup and the discount have not been available if you go throught booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Inter Hotel is the best small hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Annerione
Reviews.Content: There is always a welcome here from one of the three reception staff .The hotel rooms are very comfortable ( although a bit small ) and have all the convenient things like heating/air conditioning , TV, good showers with 24 hour hot water,lights switches in all the right places for the overhead light plus reading lamps etc.and the street outside is very quiet.Breakfast is very good and probably better than any other I experienced in my trip around Turkey.If you stay for three nights the hotel vehicle will meet you at Ataturk Airport.The same for returning to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: atiq198
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel but worth paying for short stay. The hotel location is an easy-access location. Less than 5 minutes walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and tramway that connect you to all the attractive places. They are providing pick-up service from airport. The room's condition is comfortable and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rajesh_Bhatia_London
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is the location. Walking distance to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia etc. The rooms are clean but basic. Decent breakfast in the morning. Helpful staff. If you are not expecting luxury then this is the place for you. Very affordable rates and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: snowtiger66
Reviews.Content: Nice small place, close to Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque. We arrived late, and they recommended a good restaurant down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located, friendlich and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Patrick Z
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter is located on a quiet lane and at the same time very close to the tramway (Beyazit) which takes you to all interesting sights. The rooms are clean and the hotel is obviously investing step by step (new bathroom and windows). The staff which speaks a good English is very friendly and helpful (reservation and advices for restaurants, sights). I recommend this hotel for groups and families.

Reviews.Title: “A great address in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Andreas L
Reviews.Content: With a group of 20, I stayed at the Hotel Inter in Istanbul. We enjoyed our stay a great deal; the hotel offers great value for money, the staff are very friendly and the location is very central yet quiet. I can wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Inter.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to the Great Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: Janusz B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, so we got an extra free pick up to the hotel and drop off to Ataturk airport. At arrival we received a twin room with a street view, the room was basic but very clean and functional, with professional room-service (everyday cleaning and fresh towels are provided). At the first night we left windows opened, and we were woken up by the screaming muezzin in the early morning (about 5 am). Remember, where you are, it is Istambul. If you donâ€™t like it just close the windows, they give an excellent sound isolation. Inter Hotel has an excellent location - very close to the Great Bazaar, 10-15 min. walk to the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. The BeyazÄ±t tram station is located in about 2-3 min. walk. We used an electronic safebox and founded it very useful. The WLAN signal was very strong in every floor. Full breakfast is included, enough to give you a good start for the active day. The reception staff are friendly & very helpful, offer good practical information if asked. Overall we recommend this hotel to anyone, except people looking for more luxury accommodation. Stayed in October 2011, travelled as a couple (Cracow, Poland)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maggie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days in September and three in October and totally felt at home there. It was close to the main street and main features. The breakfasts were yummy, the staff were unobstrusive and most helpful and friendly. We learned a few words in Turkish and were delighted that we were understood! I loved to take an early coffee outside and watch the activity in the street! Great! I would definitely stay there again if I returned to that wonderful city, Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Met few countrymen from Malaysia here”
Reviews.Author: rajafariz
Reviews.Content: Value for money hotel. Stayed here for 5 nights..good location and friendly staff. Just a few walks away from the train station and Istanbul landmarks such as Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. I met few families from Malaysia here..if you walk to the east side, you will see the Marmara sea (if i am not mistaken)..soothing cold breeze will greet you here..good hotel to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CapeFear
Reviews.Content: Location is close to public transport (3 min to Tramvay station Beyazit which takes you to EminÃ¶nÃ¼ ferry port or to Beyoglu). Sultanahmet mosque and Aya Sofia is also just a short walk away (aprox. 15 min). The area around the hotel is okay but you should not mind the screaming muezzin in the morning since there is a small mosque nearby. Rooms are small but efficient and most important, clean. There was no mold in the bathroom. Towels were exchanged daily. Soap and slippers were provided and there was a simple air conditioner and a heater in the room. The hotel was quiet and the windows were good. The double-bed was good and there was an extra beed in our room. There was a small closet with a working safe but no shelves so it was a bit too small for a four-nights-stay. There is a simple but okay breakfast. Eggs (boiled/fried/scrambled), bread, yogurt, muesli, cake, sigara bÃ¶rek, sausage, cheese (cow/sheep), olives, tomatoes, cucumber, jam and honey, tee, coffee and juices. There were only two friendly staff members during our stay. The guy at check-in was hardly able to greet us. The service staff at breakfast seems voiceless. The hotel bar in the lobby is small and quite expensive compared to the Istanbul prices. There is one computer in the lobby were you can use internet for free. But the connection is not very fast. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel, rude reception staff, no atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: carnaburg_management
Reviews.Content: I cant see what all the fuss is about, I did not enjoy my stay here, the reception staff were like chalk and cheese, one shift helpful and pleasant and the other shift moody and quite rude, on facebook all the time! I think i was in a refurbished room, it was clean but the beds were so uncomfortable. We did not really enjoy our trip here and would not come back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best accommodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sanwariqbal
Reviews.Content: IÂ returned home with pleasant and Â sweet memories from my 2nd home Turkey last week. Â  I am very impressed for managing skills of professional staff of Hotel Inter which made my stay excellent and unforgettable. I feel immense pleasure to say that this hotel is very comfortable with an excellent complementary buffet breakfast. The staff is very polite and active, specially the manager-LatifÂ KURTULMUS is wonderful person, always keen to facilitate you.Â  Dr S. Anwar Iqbal Islamabad, PAKISTANÂ

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great value”
Reviews.Author: Laurentnoel
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and simple, safe hotel with friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Nice en-suite bathrooms, fresh towels every day, good breakfast, free pick-up from Ataturk airport if you stay 3 nights or more. Free wi-fi, great location near tram 1 Beyazit. They have a variety of rooms from single rooms from 50 â‚¬, up to family rooms @ â‚¬100. If you book from their own website www.hotelinteristanbul.com you can pay a deposit and then settle in cash when you are there with a 10% discount, making it even better value. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A really friendly staff and nice accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Erika B
Reviews.Content: The location is great, only few minutes you will find the Grand Bazaar. The staff is so friendly, they will help you to spend your time wisely. Our room was clean and big enough. The breakfast was yummy. I will recomend this hotel and definately i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownRosemary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not only a convenient location, but very clean and very comfortable. The staff are friendly and the breakfast delicious. Very reasonable rates and altogether a good place to stay which is situated 5 mins from the Grand Bazaar and the tram. I have been before and will stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Valuer for money”
Reviews.Author: Luka_luka22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Beyazit station and Grand Bazar, also just 2 tram stops from the heart of Istanbul, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and everything else. The area where the hotel is located is rather "traditional", with en-gross shops, local people and everything, but in just 2 minutes you exit at the tram station and the main boulevard. Although looking a bit weird at night, I would say is rather safe, given the fact that I came at 12 in the night and everything was calm and quiet. For those of you who want to spend extra-money, I would recommend a hotel located a little bit near the central area (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque), but this area is good also. As I was saying, the Grand Bazar is right across the street so those of you looking for the traditional shopping will be delighted. The hotel itself is very very clean, the rooms are basic, but the cleanliness is the main advantage. The price can be discussed either on e-mail, either on the reception. You get a 10% discount for paying in cash. If you get one of the rooms 602 or 603, the view is very nice, overlooking to the sea so in the morning is very nice to wake up and look to the window. For the price of the room you get free breakfast which is quite ok, they have a selection of the important things (cereals, yogurt, scrambled eggs, some cheese, some vegetables, some fresh fruits, olives) and drinks (orange juice not made from real fruits, but just instant drink) I would recommend going a little bit earlier, like 8 o'clock, cause around 9 it gets crowded. Overall, very decent for a hotel. The staff was polite, helpful, speaking English at a decent level for Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone expecting a decent experience at a normal price. As an alternative I would say that you can try a hotel near Blue Mosque area - Cemberlitas or Sultanhamet tram station (like Rast hotel - much more expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: ghiocel
Reviews.Content: A budget hotel, however it all depends if the receptionists give you a refurbished room or not:) At arrival we received a room like I have never seen in my life! The most outdated room ever and one of the dirtiest. Let me picture it: dark ; small twin beds, small room, furniture from the 60's (or 70's at best); a pole in the middle of the room (guess it was a pillar of resistance or smth) between the beds (the person using the bed behind this pole cannot watch TV - because he/she has a big pillar in his face:); very very small TV with a broken remote control. Toilet that almost flooded after one use. And on top of all these - the window opened to a cement wall. No ski, no nothing! The hotel should not use these rooms - they are a nightmare and it should be embarrassing for them - but I guess it is not. It took them 2 nights to give me another room. The new room was ok - refurbished, clean, with a street view - decent. So, all in all - ask for a nice/ refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornelOprea
Reviews.Content: Good location right across the street from the Grand Bazar and the BeyazÄ±t mosque. The BeyazÄ±t Tram station is very close so getting to the main tourist attractions is quite easy . The rooms are basic but very clean and functional . You get beds , nightstands , a drawer with a safe ( I found it very useful ) and a TV (mostly turkish channels ) . AC is provided and it comes in handy given the fact that the summer days are pretty hot in Istanbul. Wifi is also available and free , just ask for the password at the reception. Breakfast is included , nothing special but enough to give you a start for the day .

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Mike E
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice and comfortable stay. Everything was taking care of in time. Very clean rooms. Very professional service. We recommend it to family, friends, and anybody who wants to stay in Istanbul with a peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “As good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Kamyar_77
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Istanbul . As I had read in the reviews , I expected to go to a comfortable & nice budget hotel . But why ? First of all , we couldn't reserve the hotel because in Iran paying via Master card or other international credit cards is unavailable . So we reserved the room for 7 nights without pre paying . As they mentioned , there was a free pick up from Ataturk airport . The passport check line was very crowded and our luggage was found a bit late , so the guy from hotel had to stay about one & half our more and he did ( We just had 100 dollar money so we could not tip him in the hotel :( ) The room was clean , the ACs were working , the wireless signal was very strong in every floor ( we were in the 6th - and last - floor ) , and of course every room had a place for LAN cable ( my laptop's wireless driver was not working ) . The internet speed was high . We could watch almost every Persian satellite channel from our room , and there was an electronic safe box in the closet . And as the other guest have mentioned , the bath , the location and the cleaniness were very good . Also the breakfast was very good , there was a lot of choices ( but the breakfast room was a bit small and in the last days a group of Italians were there and the tables could be not enough ) .

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location”
Reviews.Author: dom1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room for 3 days in July. This hotel is really well located being next to the grand bazzar & also a tram stop. This area is lively with many restaurants & shops as well as other interesting thing to see. The main historical sites are a gentle 15 minutes walk down hill or alterntively you can take the tram to the centre. Overall the rooms are clean & confortable & really good value considering their budget cost. Actually I was agreeably surprised to find our rooms having good air conditionning (essential in summer time) & the bathrooms that had been freshly renovated. Breakfast was pretty basic, but OK. The reception staff are friendly & very helpful & always offer good tourist information if asked. Overall we recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's our home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TurkishDLight
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter is our home in Istanbul, we stayed one week, then went to other places in Turkey, then again came back to the wonderful staff, and easy & relaxing location, close to the tram but so quiet at night, not like the other busy & noisy hotels. Advantages are cleanliness, helpful staff, safe deposit box, easy access to transportation. No disadvantages were remarked during our stay that's why it's our home & for sure if we come back to Turkey, hotel Inter Istanbul will be our destination.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people, neat room, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TheShoppelifter
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have stayed during this trip. Excellent location, near to the Grand Bazaar, about 10 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, quiet side street, restaurants, atms, money exchange nearby, and so is the tramvay station of beyazit. I cannot fault the hotel as I was fully satisfied, the friendly staff, the clean room with double bed is a comfort at night, small fridge, ACâ€™s working, windows overlooking the small street below. TV has English channels which is nice as I can watch the news â€“ the only thing I watch every time Iâ€™m on the road. The cabinet has a safety deposit box and another on the ground floor if you feel to have that double safety assurance and if you have valuables. Although for me, the one on the cabinet is enough already. So many clothes hangers that you could hang even your undies -- am I the only one doing that? The door has two locks from the inside for those who have OCD :-) The toilet is very clean with hairdryer and liquid soap, shower is very strong, and towels are fresh everyday. Also, there's a disposable slippers for those who doesn't want to step on the carpet barefoot. The wifi is very strong on all floors from the lobby to the last floor â€“ I transferred on the upper on my 3rd night. Breakfast is excellent too upto almost 11:00am! And thereâ€™re lots to choose from and some fruits too. Coffee is not the instant thing I always find at some budget hotels. Thereâ€™s a PC on the lobby which I used several times as I was making emails for work at almost midnight and I find it hard to type many letters on my smartphone. Very comfortable budget hotel highly recommended if you want to stay within the historical district of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inter is our home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SaliCanada
Reviews.Content: We have been three times already. Excellent managment, clean rooms and very friendly staff. It's located in the heart of Istanbul where we enjoyed our lovely visit. If you need to smile, chitchat or an answer to a question, do not hesitate to talk to Latif, Matin or Uhor. Breakfast is very healthy and seasonal. I know that I will always go back because it's my home.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HobbieDorchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Beyazit close to the Grand Bazaar and the Cemberlitas Turkish bath and near the Beyazit tram stop with only two stops to Sultanahmed with access to the Aya Sofiya, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Three stops further on brings one to the Spice Market and Eminonu where the ferries leave to the Golden Horn, the Asian side and one cantake the Bosphorus cruise. The hotel has good clean rooms with TV, a pleasant lounge entrance with bar and a good inclusive buffet breakfast at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and location”
Reviews.Author: JulD
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights with a friend. This hotel is at a walking distance of all the major touristic sites and next to a tram station. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. The breakfast was good and had a good variety. The staff was very polite and helpful. They come to pick you up at the airport and can arrange transport for 20 euros total at the end of the trip. You have a computer that you can use for free and a free wifi that works really well in your room. There is also a safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable hotel in the middle of everything in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: issa_pineda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so convenient in terms of its location. It is in the middle of the city of Istanbul so its very much accesible to all the sight seeing spots in the city. The staff were so friendly special mention to Latif and the housekeeping guys who made out room very neat and tidy on a daily basis. We so much love the breakfast they serve. the rooms are very clean and the rooms rate is reasonable. i would definitely come back to this hotel. Thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quality per low price”
Reviews.Author: epat029
Reviews.Content: Very good location in walking distance to historical places of Istanbul, eg. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc. Rooms and bathrooms are always clean although not very large. Breakfasts simply but very good. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. They helped us to find taxis, choice bus and ferry connections, etc. Perfect quality vs. price. They provide discounts as well as free airport pick-up service.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and experience”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLou
Reviews.Content: Being three female family members traveling in Istanbul, we always felt comfortable and safe in Hotel Inter Istanbul. The entire staff were wonderful, especially Latif and Metin. Latif gave us wonderful recommendations, advice and directions around Istanbul which made our travel experience memorable. The hotel was clean and comfortable, with a great location. Also, there is a cozy restaurant right around the corner from the hotel. The food is simple but good and very convenient to the hotel (believe it is called Istanbul restaurant and is located on Mithatpasa Cad.) We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family for future travel plans. We loved visiting Turkiye... Istanbul, Kusadasi and Ephesus. It truly exceeded our expectations and we are so happy we were able to visit such a interesting culture and country. The Smith Family Seattle, WA - USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: ryk
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and helpful, hotel is near tram stop, Grand Bazaar and major tourist attractions in the Sultanahmet area are within walking distance. Airport is another nice thing if it's your first time to Istanbul or your 10th time, nice to see a friendly and familiar face on arrival. I've stayed at several other hotels in other parts of Turkey and for a hotel in this price range: it has the best breakfast layout. While some rooms are a bit small compared to other more expensive hotels that should be expected. I've spent up to 5 days with 2 people in residence and found them adequate. One is there to experience the wonders of Istanbul, not spend time in the room. I've never heard noise from other rooms in all the many times I've stayed at the Inter - I do admit that if you have your window open and are not used to it, morning prayer call will probably wake you up. Don't hear it with window closed. For the past several years, Turkey has forbidden smoking in public places so lounge is smoke free and has signs stating to the fact. A recent comment about people smoking in hallways and there rooms - one cannot always control the actions of rude guests or those tho believe rules do not apply to them. Upgrades have been done over the years - another recent comment of interest - no carpet in the rooms. They used to have it but it was changed to a wood floor which many places are now going to. Easier to clean and who knows what may be lurking in the carpet you are walking barefoot on.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: mlaperle
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was excelent, very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, and well worth the price. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Adamfire
Reviews.Content: A basic, comfortable hotel. No great frills but centrally located and with a friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast was good and airport pick-up was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for the traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: cspacenz
Reviews.Content: Nearing the end of a three month trip in India and pretty much out of cash, having to stop off in Istanbul for 2 nights on my way home from a brief visit to Germany unexpectedly and especially having just had my home city of Christchurch devastated by a massive earthquake days before I was very pleased to stay at Hotel Inter. I found their communication excellent via email, their directions via tram and train from the airport excellent and the check in was effortless. The rooms are small and a little dated but exceptionally clean and completely practical. I actually had "sea glimpses" (as opposed to a view, which was a bonus really as I would not have thought that possible) The location for going to the Grand Bazaar couldn't be much better and less than 100 metres from the tram. The breakfast was actually really good with plenty of variety and goes till 10.30am. There is a lift so it's not all stairs and anything your require by way of help from reception you will find them to be very friendly and helpful. Free internet is a fantastic bonus these days when most hotels rip you off something terrible for something that should be like electricity in this day and age...FREE ! Well done on that Hotel Inter. The one thing that reminds me that Turkey is not much more than a third world country is that they allow smoking in the hotel. People will come out of their rooms to smoke in the hallways, but worst of all some people will actually smoke in their tiny little lift and this is disgraceful in the 21st century. We just don't want people's filthy poisonous gases, plain and simple. It's time to get a grip on this one and ban the smoking in your hotels. One good thing was that they do NOT allow smoking in the breakfast restaurant, thank God ! All in all I was happier with this simple low-priced hotel than I have been with so many much more expensive hotels I have stayed at and would not hesitate to sty here again or to recommend it to anyone else. It is not flashy, it is basic, that is reflected in the price so if you want 5 star then go stay in a 5 star hotel but don't stay here and complain because it's not.. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Awesome Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maryam1980
Reviews.Content: Fast feedback online and the very best affordable price ever to suit traveler budget. Good package i.e. free drop off or pick up (stay more than 3 nights) Perfect location for exploring the old city and all its major sights. Complete hotel facilities and the cleanliness is superb. Friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Salomesalome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Inter with my husband when we spent our New Year holidays in Istanbul. I can say that Hotel Inter is a very good option to choose within the budget they require. I liked the cleanliness of the rooms and the service. They team was very friendly and always keenly answered lots of questions I used to ask them.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Best Location, Comfortable Rooms, Tasty Breakfasts!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenia_Makarenko
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Inter Istanbul on my parents' recommendation and it was a really wonderful stay there! LOCATION is perfect for those who prefer walkable distances to different historical SIGHTS. Calm and nice street, beautiful NEIGHBOURHOOD, 2 min walking to Grand Bazaar! Around 10 min walking to the Gold Horn Embankment through pretty small streets and great amount of homelike restaraunts. HOTELl is very pretty, comfortable and clean! Small, as we prefer small ones, with a very freindly STAFF always ready to help with advice or whatever. And special thanks for BREAKFASTS in the Hotel Inter Istanbul - firstly, they are very tasty, secondly - as I was with my fiance - it was really enough to feel satiety even for him :))) Moreover, they have free WI-FI INTERNET in the rooms and lobby which is important :) And of course I should mention FREE TRANSFER option! This is so convinient to those like us who come to this wonderful city for the first time! To summerize, couse I'm full of impressions, Hotel INTER ISTANBUL is the best choise if you would like to spend reasonable money for the nice, calm and charming stay in the very center of all the sights you want to visit in Istanbul! Hope to come again soon and lots of thanks to Hotel STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay during vacation”
Reviews.Author: zaahmad
Reviews.Content: 1)Very friendly & helpful staff esp Latif & Metin 2) Bountiful choice of breakfast -delicious! 3) Very clean room & toilet & towels 4) Strategic location-very near Grand Bazaar , Beyazit mosque ,tram,etc 5) Free wifi 6) Free shuttle transfer from airport to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Good Location, Affordable, Decent Breakfast & Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ravish81
Reviews.Content: 1. Staff - Well, the first set of ppl that one ends up trusting while touring is the Hotel Staff and thats why this place is good. The staff is honest, always ready to help u. The two receptionst that I enjoyed talking to were Latif & Metin. I always use to pick up some chit chat with Latif while goin out and coming back and he was more than happy to talk and answer my queries. I can't forget the first day when i askd bout need to hire services of sme tour operator and though they cud hve got sme commission, I was told not to as the old Istanbul is within walking distance. No one will offer that kinda advise easily. 2. Location - Well this is the best part, this hotel is very near to the the bus stand, metro and all other tourist destinations of old Istanbul are within walking range. Rest you can always catch a metro and visit. Also since its in a lane behind the main road so it offers all the peace u need to sleep at night (smethin u might nt get say if u stay at sme place on the famous Istikal Caddesi) 3. Affordability - Its a very good value for money if u r visitng Istanbul for Istanbul and nt to spend time in the Hotel. They offer nice, decent and clean room. If thats all u r lookin for. 4. Morning breakfast is decent and whether u r a veggie or non-veggie, u can start ur day with full tummy :) ..... FEW GENERAL TIPS: [didnt know whr else to share this ;) ....] 1. Do buy AKBIL (its a electronic pass that is accepted in every public transport - metro, bus, funicular, ferries/boats) and make ur life easy while travelling. 2. I am a complete vegetarian & found these places with great difficulity - Parsifal & Zencefil resturants ... both r on Istiklal Caddesi and within a difference of 50 mts & opposite to each other. 3. As far as the bhosphorous cruise goes - half day bhosphorous cruise which is of around 2 hrs is sufficient (full day option is waste of time, unless u r a cruise freak) 4. Take some time out and one ur first day, take a ride on HopOn HopOff bus, the good part is they will take u around all the places in Istanbul which r worth seeing and u can also get down at some places to visit em and then board the next bus. These are red in colour & double decker and start from Sultanahmet Center (Across St. Sophia). 5. If ur hotel is givin u free pick up from airport then its fine and if u want to avoid the costly taxi then take a Havas bus which goes till Taksim Square or take metro. Believe me metros are comfortable. 6. Some useful links: http://www.istanbulhotels.net/images/large-istanbul-rail-system-map.jpg (dowload map of metro from this site) http://www.adiyamanli.org/istanbul-subways/istanbul-subways.htmlhttp://www.adiyamanli.org/hop-on-hop-off/hop-on-hop-off.html http://www.allistanbultours.com http://istanbul.mydestinationinfo.com/en/how-much-does-it-cost-in-istanbul http://www.turizm.net www.kultur.gov.tr

Reviews.Title: “Everything very nice, nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: okipey
Reviews.Content: Good location, functional and very clean room on the top with sea view. The service was very nice and the reception was very nice and friendly and gave us a lot of very good advices and information about the city. The pick up service at the airport worked out without any problem. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Clean Rooms, Good Breakfast, Overall Good value”
Reviews.Author: MoJo_Leic
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 7 nights. It's not a Marriott or De Vere class hotel, but a basic, clean hotel, ideally located for all the major places of interest with friendly and helpful staff. Our rooms were on the top floor, the lift goes up to the 5th floor only and then a few short steps on to the 6th floor. The showers in the bathrooms were great, very powerful hot water, just what you need after a day's walking around Instanbul and first thing in the morning. The hotel also provides a wide selection of food for breakfast including juices, bread rolls, eggs, cheese, fresh fruit, cereal...something for everyone! The eggs are delicious and it's worth making the effort to go down to the basement for breakfast. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and they will help you to plan your days out and give you suggestions for the best way to get around. The tram and ferry system is the best method to get around Istanbul and I would advise anyone visiting to purchase an 'Akbil' token. It works like an Oyster Card. Cheap and efficient to get around instead of using expensive taxi's. The hotel is located close to the Grand Bazzar, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, Topkapi Museum, Bascillica Cistern, etc. To get to Taksim Sq it's a tram ride of about 15 minutes. The hotel is located in the Sultamahmet district of Instanbul. Reasonable selection of places to eat out but shop around and don't go to the TARIHI SULTANAHMET KÃ–FTECISI this place is over rated, over priced and very bland food. Ignore the reviews! You'll find better food elsewhere in Sultanahmet or Taksim. I would recommend this hotel for anyone that requires basic, clean accommodation located close to the attractions. As always, it would be unbalanced to just write praise so in terms of improvements I would suggest that the hotel re carpets the stairs and the bed rooms. The rooms on the 6th floor have laminate floors. Elsewhere the carpets look grotty and could do with replacing to really make the hotel shine. My thanks go to the hotel staff and management to make our stay in Instanbul an enjoyable one. After all staying in a nice, clean hotel is a large part of the overall holiday experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyFalkirk
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast with fresh fruit, ham, cheese, fresh bread, potato omlette etc. We really liked that transport to the hotel was included (if you stayed more than 3 nights) as our flight arrived very late at night. The hotel staff communicated very well with me prior to our arrival and answered all my questions. Very nice bathroom for a no frills hotel, room basic but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “great value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: juanaoaxaca
Reviews.Content: For a no frills hotel in a great location, the Hotel Inter would be hard to beat. The breakfast room is cheerful, the clientele is international, and there are tables on the sidewalk in front where one can sit and have a drink. The rooms are spotlessly clean, very basic, with everything one needs, including free, efficient internet access. The staff is friendly and helpful. Turkish is a challenge, and they speak good English, which is a big help. The free shuttle service to the airport is a real plus. The hallways are dark, and the decor is minimal, but the prices are very fair, and the breakfast is generous. For the traveler who is out enjoying the city most of the day, the Hotel Inter is an excellent choice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rahims111
Reviews.Content: My family and I (six in total) were due to stay for 10 nights from 30 August .Having looked at many of the reviews on this site regarding this hotel I felt pleased that we had made the right choice.We had booked two triple rooms. When we arrived we felt somewhat uneasy at the reception area due to its unkempt and run down condition.When we were shown our rooms my wife almost fainted. The rooms were barely double rooms with three beds squeezed in.The carpets in the corridors and rooms were dirty and smelly.The lift is some remnant of an earlier age barely allowing three people to bundle in and quite frankly dangerous as it does not have a safety door so that as you go up or down you actually see the floors passing by. We were so disappointed by what we found that after the first night we thankfully found another hotel to which we moved. Rahim (England)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilviuVisan
Reviews.Content: We've spent 7 nights in Istanbul. The hotel is just great! Very good position (close to most historical atractions, grand bazar and tram station). Staff very friendly and very prepared(good english and helpful indications). The room was big enough, LCD, A/C, mini fridge Wi/Fi. Very clean. Nice bathroom. Daily cleaning.Breakfast more than OK. Overall a very nice hotel with good prices.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel in istanbul, excellant area, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mosul18
Reviews.Content: from the early reservation the staff was friendly, the were at airport, and they offered us what we expected for 2 weeks in istanbul, from clean rooms to daily trip advices, as a big family with children it was in a good area, near to historical sites and grand bazar, near to the transportation options of istanbul. i recomend it to stay as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AALGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at INTER hotel in Istanbul. we were a big family with youg children. the hotel staff were fantastic, friendly and helpful. Will not hesitate to take the extra step to help you and give you the right advise on where to go and how to get there. they were always on time. The hotel is clean and tidy and its location is central with very reasonable price. I will recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “More Marvellous!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tweetyCairo
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time to stay in Inter Istanbul. I just want to say that it is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in,<I travel a lot>. The Manager ,The receptionists Mr. Latif, Mr.Ugur, & Mr. Metin are very helpful, & friendly. The waiters,& driver are very polite. The hotel is renovated & is very ,very clean! Due to some circumstances,at the begining of my trip,I stayed in a hotel in Taksim, I was not happy at all & moved to my favorite Inter. I want to congratulate the owner, & thank every staff member.I will always stay in it! Keep it up!!!!!!!! .This my fourth time to stay in Inter.It is one of the best hotels I found. Due to some circumstances I stayed in Taksim in another hotel but was not satisfied ,so i moved to Inter when I found an available room. I want to thank the Manager, The receptionists Mr. Latif,Mr. Ugur, & Mr.Metin.They are very nice, friendly & helpful. I also want to thank the whole staff for the good work! The hotel is very,very, clean; Breakfast is very rich, Location is perfect! Trams & buses are very close. It is safe to stay there. I want to congratulate the owner, i will always stay ther whenever in Istanbul. Keep it up!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hakim4
Reviews.Content: It gaves me pleasure with my family to spend marvelous 5 days in hotel Inter, very nice hotel, tidy and clean, very quiet, great location, all sightseeing in walking distance, tram, grand bazar, historical sites, you can reach all the important places and services in few minutes, good breafast, pick-up servise free, and the very important thing that the friendly and nice warm staff. any way I can't find suitable words to express my feeling realy. But I would like to say whenever I visit Istanbul my first choice will be Hotel Inter.

Reviews.Title: “Internationally Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: AngelCrow
Reviews.Content: I had five days in comfort with three of my best friends in this hotel â€“ pure example of value for money â€“ and the words canâ€™t say enough. The hotel is located in the southern, historical centre of Istanbul, on a sokak close to the Divan Yolu main road, but far enough to avoid the central noise and traffic. The tram station in the main roadâ€™s opening connects every place of interest in Istanbul, which are all of them located at 1km maximum, from the hotel. Peaceful enough for a hotel in a major city. Central. Accessible. Perfect! And the road to perfection continues highways: discreet, polite, knowledgeable and flexible staff clean and tidy rooms, deluxe bathroom and shower (great banana flavored shower gel!) more than rich and tasty traditional buffet breakfast, welcome drinks, free wifi and even a computer at the lobby in case of need, free transfer from or to the airport (!) and a room rate not even close to the usual medium/high season hotel rates. I mean really, this rate almost cannot justify the level of offers and the quality peak of this hotel, especially in one of the oldest, largest and most popular cities in the world! I have loads of experience in tourism industry and my fare share of trips around, so mark my word: no western style oriented hotel can beat this â€“ and if it can I would definitely want to know more about it!

Reviews.Title: “You will not find better all around service than this hotel provides.”
Reviews.Author: BillCampbell123xyz
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with every aspect of my stay at this hotel. From the warm reception to the free shuttle to the airport on departure, I found every employee dedicated to the job of pleasing the guest. The expansive, free breakfast includes just about anything that anyone could want to eat. The rooms are efficiently arranged with hair dryer and electrical outlet in the bathroom. Free use of the mini-fridge in each room. Lovely, comfortable lobby. So very conveniently located to the tourist sights of Sultanahmet. Just a short walk to the sea, Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and many other interesting places. I would like to commend especially Latif Kurtulmus for his attention to my every need during my 15 day stay. They all speak English, so there is no worry about communications with them. Definitely worth a lot more than they charge.

Reviews.Title: “great loctaion!”
Reviews.Author: ViennaSandra
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with great location, very quiet, any sightseeing-location in walking-distance, tram-station nearby, friendly staff, good breakfast, pick-up service from airport for free, discount if you pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulJune2010
Reviews.Content: It's quite near to a tram station. The room is clean & spacious. Breakfast is good. It's value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent location, frienldy staff and great services”
Reviews.Author: Balaur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, close to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Top Capi Saray. I really enjoyed staying there. The rich and wonderful breakfast were a real benefit. I will recommend Hotel Inter to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, friendly, excellent location 10/10”
Reviews.Author: dorisandelvis
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip based on reviews from trip advisor and I was so pleased I had trusted them! If you book a room on the street side, and higher up, the rooms are brighter. All in all, it was clean, had A/C so we never got hot, TV with enough channels, excellent breakfast included which filled us up ready for a day of sight-seeing, beds were comfy and the staff were very accomodating. The location is perfect if you want to see the old city. Especially if you are interested in shopping in the Bazaar which can take hours - you get the chance to pop back to the hotel should you need a rest in between all that walking! Tram stop is nearby but we found we walked to most places. Free internet in the lobby was very useful too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneOzCouple
Reviews.Content: Dear Inter staff, We recently stayed at your hotel for 3 days. This is to let you know how much we have enjoyed our stay there and how much we have appreciated your assistance and the friendly and helpful staff. The room was nice and clean and had a safety box for our valuables. The location was excellent so we could walk to all tourist objectives. Your help with reasonably priced airport transfer was especially useful and appreciated, because of the sad exploitation of tourists by unscrupulous transport operators. The rich and wonderful breakfast, the reasonably priced coffees & beers (where all restaurants charged double), were a real benefit. We have no hesitation in warmly commending your hotel . Best regards Adriana & Iris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: IoanaIoana
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very frienldy staff and great services. The price was very good too. The hotel is well located, close to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Sf. Sofia. We had some problems with the arrival date, they helped us to change the reservation in a few minutes. The breakfast was good, too. A very customer frienly attidude, I really enjoyed staying there. This is not a hotel for those who want great views or spa centers, but it's the perfect place for staying if you want just to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best cost / benefit”
Reviews.Author: guilherme_domingues
Reviews.Content: Well location, with very good service and excellent price. Latif is a nice host, with so many hints to whom wants to explore Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Interhotel from the 5-12 may 2010 when we arrived at Ataturk airport we had no idea that we needed a visa which made queing up longer .The courtesy pick up from the hotel waited patiently for us for over an hour within half an hour we were at the hotel and in our rooms 603.Aclean room with a view over the Marmaris sea.The hotel is very peaceful without any hussle and bussle and the staff ready to help in any way with information we needed about travelling around currency exchange and where to go to eat the postition of the hotel is superb since you can walk within 10 minutes to the Grand Bazaar Blue Mosque Ayia sofia and the Topkapi Palace.Theres no need to use the jam packed buses and Trams. There is an abundance of shops and restuarants around the hotel.Theres no way you can get lost since the hotel is off the main Caldessi (road)which has a tramline Follow that and it will take you to Galati bridge over the other side of the city to Tunel and the Iskilal Caldessi for night life and shopping. The buffet breakfast is great and between 7-10am Cereals,fresh breads,yoghurt,fresh fruit eggs meats Jams ect. One more thing to say is that the staff have a great sense of humour.if and when we go back to Istanbul we'll definitely be staying at the hotel Inter again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a spotless, beautifully renovated, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Europeantraveller1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Istanbul by the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, the beautiful waterfront and many tourist sites. It is a haven of tranquillity providing immediate calm in a sea of bustle and activity. The staff were kind and obliging, the reception calm and welcoming and the rooms [as the rest of the hotel] were spotlessly clean. I highly recommend this hotel. It is incredibly good value for money - I was very pleasantly surprised at the high standards given the very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The best quality for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Anyuta_m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Inter for 7 nights from May 2 until May 9 and I can assure you that all of us were completely satisfied by the level of service and amenities. The one and only possible disadvantage of this hotel is it's location - Beyazit area which is 2 tram stops away from Sultanahmet (about 10 min. walk). But for me it was even better as the tram stop is really close so you can go wherever you want including Galata Bridge, Dolmabahce, Taksim etc. Now I'll try to mention at least some of numerous pluses and values of this hotel. First of all the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean every time we returned home after a long day on feet, towels were changed daily, breakfast was nice and tasty, especially fresh turkish strawberries and yoghurt... I loved them so much. Also very important moment is that the hotel is located in quiet small street close to the tram line but still you will definitely hear calls for the prayer at night (as for me I only heard them on my first night there). The room we lived in was quite spacious and full of light, with simple but nice and fresh furniture and comfy beds. But the best thing in the morning for me was the view over Marmara Sea and the voices of sea gulls. So I would definitely recommend room 602 (if you're lucky). TV had several english speaking channels plus NBA channel (my boyfriend was watching it all the time). Besides there's individual airconditioner, WiFi and personal safe in the room. But the most valuable feature of the hotel are hospitality and its staff. Everyone was so helpful friendly and nice that we felt like VIP guests. I would definitely stay in Hotel Inter on my next visit to Istanbul and recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: futomaki79
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of the reviews and price. Was even better value because we offered to pay in cash. Very happy with this choice, location excellent, good choice of places to eat and staff helpful. They replied quickly to all emails especially as I had to cancel a room because our friends couldn't join us because of the volcanic ash problems. Definitely good choice!

Reviews.Title: “a 2 star hotel with 4 star staff!”
Reviews.Author: cestovatel_jiri
Reviews.Content: We especially appreciated the kind and accommodating staff, and being in the heart of the Old Town - buses, trams, and the Grand Bazaar are around the corner, and all the sights within walking range.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to Istanbul-Ephesus-Pamukkale”
Reviews.Author: lonetravellerSEAsia
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff has kindly allowed me to store my big luggage bag while I backpack/tour in Ephesus and Pamukkale. Although only a one-way pick-up from the airport is provided for 3-night stay, they have kindly arrange for complimentary return trip from hotel to the airport for longer stay (more than 6 nights). This is my first visit to Istanbul and hope to return for another visit, possibly with friends. Have recommended Turkey as a good tourist destination.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inter is my the most favourite hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: DARWINPrague
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter is my the most favourite hotel in Istanbul, with the best breakfast and very nice rooms. The staffs are very friendly and everybody speaks English. I was there five-times and I was very satisfied always!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: michelleumit
Reviews.Content: This is the third time me and my finacee have stayed here. Staff are very hospitable,and accomodating- we forgot a continental plug and they gave us one free of charge and we needed an extension lead (to use DVD palyer) which they lent to us for the whole week. Rooms are warm, spacious and very clean- even if you sleep late in the morning or do not leave until the mid afternoon, they do not disturb you to clean your room! It is really wonderful not to be disturbed and even better to come back after a day walking and your room has still been cleaned! The lcoation of this hotel is excellent - right near mot of the main sights and the sea, with thousands of places to eat. You will never be hungry here! But what is the best part of this hotel is you can pay in sterling cash and not loose out on the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Thanxxxx”
Reviews.Author: BelgradeOlly
Reviews.Content: Quite recently I've stayed 5 days in the Hotel Inter in Istanbul.The Hotel is situated at the heart of historical part of the city, but it isn't only advantage.What's more important is its great, friendly staff, excellent service, clean rooms, free internet and quite cosy, domestic atmosphere in the hotel. Thank you very much, I won't choose another hotel next time I'm in this magnificent city.....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inter is my home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: areej_sa3
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Hotel Inter Istanbul two years ago for a MONTH. I felt very comfortable with them because rooms are so clean and make you feel like you are home. Also, location is just great to be in the heart of Istanbul, staff is very friendly and breakfast is very healthy. When I decided to visit Istanbul for the second time, I could not think of other place to stay at except Hotel Inter. They have been very kind to offer me free airport rides especially that I stay longer. They truly value customers and use their magic to please you and have you come back to stay with them over and over.

Reviews.Title: “4me number 1 in Beyazit”
Reviews.Author: crisandemilia
Reviews.Content: very good service, staff is very friendly and helping, pick and dropp of when you stay few days, free internet ( for me very important), near to meny historical places.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Hotel Inter”
Reviews.Author: danutz1979
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at this hotel and it made for a great starting point in exploring the city. Not much to add to the previous reviews, the hotel is indeed cozy and comfy, cleanliness seems to be their top priority, with fresh and crispy towels every day. Pick-up service from the airport right on time and came in handy (although it's not difficult to reach them using public transport). Had the inspiration to ask for a room on the 6th floor (603) with a splendid view to the Marmara. Breakfast seemed plentiful. WI-FI also worked great. Way to go, guys, and thank you for making our first stay in Istanbul truly memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: emwu
Reviews.Content: Inter hotel is close to main historic buildings (10-15 minutes to go on foot) but also located round small shops, tailores, dressmakers, shoemakers etc so I really recommend it if You would like to see how real Turkish everyday live looks. Rooms are very clean, towels exchange everyday, only breakfest could be better, but in this rate is OK. Locanta near the hotel is also perfect (not over-priced like some other in Sultanahmet) place to eat (ask in the reception - they will show You which one).

Reviews.Title: “Choose Hotel Inter in Instambul, enjoy the city and its friendy people”
Reviews.Author: beautiful53
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, relaxing, warm and very friendly. We are very impressed with the hotel staff and the way they treat their guests. Perfect location in the most beautiful part of the city. Walking distance to the landmarks, most attractive for the tourists Breakfast in the hotel is substantial. The choice is proper, restaurants in reach are worth visiting. The city itself in November is really beautiful with most comfortable air temperatures. 12-14 hours outdoors Saint-Petersburg, Russia

Reviews.Title: “thank you hotel inter”
Reviews.Author: constante_ramos
Reviews.Content: location...location...location! ten minutes walk to all the historical spots of sultan ahmet like the blue mosque, aya sofia, underground basilica and topkapi palace.grand bazar is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and the tramway station too. the people at the hotel are the best you could find in the city, helpful, sincerely nice and very attentive. the room is spacious, at least the one we had, 3br 1bigger bed in the middle, with crisp sheets and extra warm blankets, the safety deposit box inside the cabinet is a plus, english news on teevee, spanking bathroom you don't need to bring your own soap except of course your toothbrush and paste. carpet is clean, they're vacuuming it daily i think. no complain whatsoever. there's a good variety of food at breakfasts, i like the sliced red and green melons and plums. the complimentary airport pickup or dropoff is another plus esp it its your first time in istanbul. you can also pay your bills in either euro, us$, turkish lira and you get the same exchange rate based on XE.com the hotel is near everything, 3 small stores in case you run out of basic necessities - 2 down the street, 1 up beside the restaurant, a sandwich kiosk at the corner, plenty of clothing shops and of course several indoor and outdoor restaurants. there's a delicious lamahcun sandwich near the grand bazaar, just cross the road in front of the tram station to the other side, not the first one but the second to ur left if your facing the grand bazaar, much cheaper and way much delicious than the first one near the bazar gate. the Sar (shar) restaurant which is a local eatery for a real turkish fast food is also near the tram station, 2 minutes walk from the hotel, don't forget to try it, affordable like spending on a local's budget. btw, you can only book the hotel through their website, you'll get an immediate response. will stay again in april next year, so see you soon lateef, metin and ugur. thank you for making our trip to the city really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpawnBaku
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Oct. 2009. The hotel is very well located, 10 minutes walking distance to the Blue Moske and 5 min to Grand Bazaar. The hotel staff was always friendly and eager to help. I would definetly consider coming back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location,value for money,really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RECYCLEONE
Reviews.Content: I did my usual research on TA for this HOTEL and saw all the positive reviews,none of which were wrong.On advise from a previous traveller,I asked for room 602,which we were given.It had a double and single bed,very roomy and a fantastic view over some tops of houses to THE BOSPHOROUS.Both the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean,the beds really comfy,wood flooring,so no horrible carpets that might have seen better days!!!!....the room also had a safe in the wardrobe,which was free to use, an LCD TV,which had several English stations. If I were to fault the rooms at all,it would be to say that the walls are very thin,you can hear noise from both the corridor and adjoining rooms.This did not concern myself as I use earplugs as a norm...as my husband is noisy sleeper!!!...we did however have a group of students in the Hotel whilst we were there and they were rather noisy,as young people are....which I totally accept...I was also young once!!! I just mentioned this to LATIF,a senior member of the reception staff as it had disturbed my husband more than me,.he was understanding and offered to move us,but to be quite honest we loved the room and I just gave my husband some coottonwool to put in his ears!!! But,to our real surprise and not at all at our request he moved the students to 2 floors down, to join their other group members and moved a family to our floor who wanted a larger room!!!!......so well done LATIF and INTER HOTEL you went above and beyond and pleased three customers in one move. Just one other thing about room 602,please be aware that the lift only goes to level 4 so you have to use the stairs to get to 602.This was no problem for us, as we did not have much luggage and we are reasonably fit senior citizens. The location is minutes away from THE GRAND BAZAAR,a 10-15 minute walk to THE BLUE MOSQUE,THE TOPKAPI PALACE,AYASOFYA.We took the tram to Eminonu,where you can get the boat trips on the Bosphorous,from here you can walk over the Galata Bridge and take a trip up the Galata Tower.We were only in Istanbul 3 nights but we saw all the usual tourist sights and found it very easy to walk around the City,loved it. The only thing I was a bit annoyed about was,the fact that you had to pay another 20TL to enter the Harem on top of the general entrance fee of 20TL,and if you wanted the audio guide it was another 20TL.So please be aware travellers!!!!......I actually printed off, from the internet ,alot of information about the Palace and took it around with us. Also,if you want to eat real Turkish food and not pay a fortune ask LATIF at the desk to show you the Turkish Cafe just around the corner from the Hotel.Wonderful food you will not be disappointed.Try the many doner plus ayra,the local yoghurt drink,we only paid 2.50TL at one of the many places along the road from the Hotel to the Blue Mosque. Just to confirm what another traveller has said on TA,the Golden Horn shopping area in the Galta Bridge area,is alot cheaper than the Bazaar.Also if you like fish,do try one of the fish sandwiches from the boats on the waters edge,you cannot miss them,you will see all the Turkish families sitting around enjoying them,they are 4TL each. I could go on and on about all the little things we came across,but I shall just finish by saying we had a FABULOUS time,and if you are about to go,enjoy,walk,take in all the sights and sounds of a fascinating Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in heart of Istanbul, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SushantKarve
Reviews.Content: Located at a excellent place, just near to market place. Also near to tram stations as well as the port down the road.Hotel staff was warm and friendly. Pick-up and Drop-off was good. Rooms would have been little better as compared to price. Reception Service as well as the Bar Service was excellent.All in all good hotel to stay . Will surely stay in this hotel during my next visit to Turkey. Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaheshAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We Indians firmly believe that nature and treatment offered by person is much more important than their economic level. Nevertheless hotel inter was not only outstanding in its treatment offered to our group but also in terms of maintaining cleanliness. I liked standing shower with glass walls to keep bathroom dry. Driver who picked us up was quite friendly. Moreover, its prime location has helped us to enjoy turkey in better manner. Many great historically significant places are just at walking distance. if you walk 10 mins down, you are on sea shore and if you walk 2 mins you will reach tram station. I would take an opportunity to thank hotel reception (night attendant) for that early morning unexpected tea @ 5.00 AM, which verifies their human touch services. It was too good to enjoy early morning tea while strolling out of hotel. Thanks for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff, all amenties & attractions close by”
Reviews.Author: londonrules
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights and found our room ready & clean. The staff tried their best to make sure we were comfortable and answered all of our questions very well in good English. This hotel will suit independent travellers and as it has a lift and a fridge in the room as well as A/C perfect for those with kids. The manager Orhan is very obliging, the senior reception staff is Latif- both speak excellently to you and help you in any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice and offers an excellent price / quality”
Reviews.Author: OtomanCasablanca
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice ... Istanbul hotel located in the center of old Istanbul close to the tram in front of the grand bazaar, a few minutes walk from the Sultanahmet area where the main attractions. Room was extremely clean and staff always ready to help you (big thank you to: Ugur, Sadek, Abdullah and Latif). Breakfast the same every day but there was a lot of choices. In summary, this hotel is a good choice and offers an excellent price / quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but would have better alternatives..”
Reviews.Author: AKrishnaPrasad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter was finalised after we thoroughly reviewed all the "Value" hotels in Istanbul; listed in Tripadvisor. We gave a thumbs-up to Inter mainly going by the large no: of favourable reviews by other travellers. I must say that I am not disappointed OVERALL by the actual experience. However my wife and I were left with this feeling that probably there could be better options in the same price range in Istanbul. First to point out the aspects we liked; the staff are very helpful, courteous and not "salesman-friendly type". Though we had a last minute change in the schedule, they were more than willing to accomodate this change. The converstations are always to the point and does not waste either party's precious time. The staff (I regretably fail to recollect the gentleman's name) at the reception efficiently helped us book tickets for an organised tour and a Semazen (Dervish) show. Patient, approachable and always present to offer help. Moving to the room, its clean, quiet and good enough for a couple who are just looking for place to catch some well earned Zzzzs.. The best part is the bathroom, which is bright, clean, relatively spacious and has a good shower cabin; plus a hair-dryer. The location is great too as its off the Beyazit main road; Bang opposite (300m) the Grand Bazaar and 200m from the Beyazit tram station. The main sights like the Cembarlitas Hamam, Blue Mosque, Sultanahmet area, great restaurants are all a brisk 10mins walk. Something we didn't quite like was the size of the room and the way it looked. It was utterly bland and spartanish. The view is a cluster of apparel shops opposite; and from our 4th floor room we could barely get a glimpse of the Marmara Sea and the ships on it (if you are on your toes) over the roofs of the building in front of the Hotel. We could mainly see a really hardworking bunch of tailors (probably working 12-14hrs) in the building opposite the hotel. As mentioned before, the bathroom was great. Then the whole hotel has a 'serious & not-so-lively' feel to it; which hits you the moment one steps in. Maybe I am expecting a lot from the 50Euros/night joint. However thats what I felt every time I stepped into the hotel and the room. It didn't seem to have the energy of a place where travellers, people on holidays, backpackers stayed and met. Lastly the hotel offers complimentary breakfast buffet; we found it really drab and ultra-boring to eat. Mainly because we saw that its the same 5-6 dishes every single morning. The restaurant is in the rather plain basement and is small place with no windows (obviously). The ambience plus the drab food is a total let down and probably the biggest negative amongst the amenities the Hotel offers. (They offer free internet access as well; which we really appreciated. However the connection speed reminded me of the speed we had in India 5 years back..be ready to spend atleast 30mins to check 2-3 mails!!) Probably I am being too much of a critic. Coz hey its a "50Euros/night joint" after all. With helpful staff and a great location. But something that I haven't been able to jot down here properly; is that we didn't get a good "holiday vibe" overall from the place.. (Guys@Inter, thanks for the drop to the Airport!) But quickly; stay here if - > you are on a budget > need to stay close to all the great sights and restaurants > need a quite lane for the night > mainly are looking only for a comfortable bed and clean loo. > are fine with small rooms

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it to friends and I shall stay in it in my next visit.”
Reviews.Author: ballasem
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in Hotel Inter and I liked its reception, services and location .

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to all the main tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: kkbelli
Reviews.Content: Hotel inter is located in the Beyazit very close to Sultanahmet's main historical spots . Its a 10 minute walk to the Blue mosque and 5 mins to the Grand Bazar. So location wise its a good place to stay. We stayed on the 5th floor in a three bedroom accommodation. We found the rooms to be clean and spacious ( the room we stayed had 4 beds) . The morning breakfast lacks a bit of imagination but if you are tourist interested more in the city than the stay ,it should be fine. There are couple of small departmental stores close by to pick up water ,munchies,etc. Inter is also just a 5 min walk from the tram station and it makes it convenient to get around the city. We found the place pretty easily by taking a tram from the airport, saving around 70$ . Paying by cash gives you a discount ( that's anywhere in Turkey ) so you might want to keep that in mind. The rooms have safes which comes in handy , On the whole Inter is pretty basic for the price you pay ,but I guess its the price you pay for being close to where the sites are.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place & friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: billy079
Reviews.Content: Nice place & friendly helpful staff, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THRUSTWORTHY”
Reviews.Author: Mannie G
Reviews.Content: Booked in Inter Hotel last August 2009 but had to cancel after a month due to work load. I just sent them an email and they returned my Deposit of 25 Euros to my credit card. Other hotels will not do that! Will definitely book again in this hotel because I read a lot of satisfied guests. I also want to experience what they experienced from staying in INTER HOTEL. Thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: queenkhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 2 adults and 2 children. Bedrooms a bit basic and could do with a facelift, but were always clean and for the price... sufficient. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, they were all always on hand and willing to assist. The foyer and breakfast room is immaculate. the breakfast buffet was truly varied, fresh and extremely tasty every morning. The Grand Bazaar is just across the road, the blue mosque and other sights are about 10 mins walk away. We truly enjoyed our stay and will be booking again for next year. Airport pick up is free... added bonus. Definately recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in this range”
Reviews.Author: Elborz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter in Beyazit Caddesi is the best hotel in this rate of money 50 Euro. It is clean as you wish and its staff are polite , friendly and helpful, specially Mr.latif and metin. It is not a luxury hotel or maybe elegant but it is OK for friends and people who look for best for a little money! Its location is very good, near the tramway station and places. Try it !

Reviews.Title: “MARVELLOUS”
Reviews.Author: tweetyCairo
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay in INTER HOTEL in BEYAZID. It is an excellent hotel ,this year it is even better than last year .They have an excellent staff ,friendly ,polite & helpful. The receptionists Mr.LATIF is great , as well as Mr.Mitten & the third decent guy <sorry dont know his name> The waiters,housekeepers & driver are lovely. The location,food {breakfast} very good , very clean rooms. I found as they promised a car waiting for us at airport & they took us exactly as we wanted . I want to thank the owner for having this excellent staff. THANKS TO EVERYONE IN INTER HOTEL!!!! Hope to visit you soon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acskss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three weeks during a student trip to Istanbul. This is a great hotel for the price. It has a fine location, is clean and comfortable with a charming staff. All my students loved this place and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeilaCasablanca
Reviews.Content: My Family and I spent 10 nights from 20th till 30th june 2009 at Hotel Inter Istanbul which I can value as one of the best hotels in the legendary city. We have had a pleasant time and enjoyed our stay amongst nice staff who is very helpful (especially Latif). As a hotelier, I can qualify the service as excellent from the pick up to the hotel till the pick up to the airport which was an added value to the global price. we stayed in a family room very spacious for 3 persons with a nice view very clean. The price matches the quality. Actually, I made the reservation in a 4* hotel via internet and ends to be in a 2* hotel because I mistook it with another hotel with the same name. I was extreemly surprised with the excellent service, the proximity to the Grand Bazar, the Blue Mosque( Sultan Ahmet), Aya Sofia, ... I highly recommed this hotel to whom wants to enjoy the stay in Istanbul and if I will have the chance to visit Istanbul I will choose Hotel Inter Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Miky0402
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. It's basic, you have a bed, a bathroom, breakfast in the morning, but it has a good location. It's 2 minutes away from the Grand Bazaar and 2 tram stations away from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. It's ok for a few days trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value for money, good location near Grand Bazar”
Reviews.Author: garciabourdon
Reviews.Content: Good price. I paid in cash E40.50 per night including breakfast. Queen size bed, flat pannel TV, free fast wireless internet, small nice shower with two glass doors. Breakfast decent, not great. Quiet location about two blocks from Grand Bazar. When I arrived I did not have any towels in my room, but this was fixed promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Motarjem
Reviews.Content: We appreciated a lot the free airport/hotel transport. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was very good, the employees were nice and helpful. The location was excellent, it was near the Bazar and the Blue Mosque. Also very close to the tram station, so no need to take a taxi because taxis there are a daylight robbery! I also appreciated the free internet connection, very practical to check your mails.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cypriot63
Reviews.Content: excellent value for money. great location. We would definately go to this hotel again. The staff are friendly and helpful. Clean rooms. Breakfast was very adequate. Everything is easy to get to. Many touristic attractions are walkable distance. There are trams that run to and from the hotel to near attractions. THe famous bazaar is 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic and a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: nargile
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to istanbul and inter hotel. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are very clean sheets changed every other day, the towels every day. The breakfast was great. For the price I think that this hotel is fantastic. Its location is perfect for any tourist to get to the attractions some within walking distance. I would recommend it to anyone including families.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Cobblespal
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK THE HOTEL INTER ISTANBUL IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A 'NICE' HOTEL!!! That said, it is perfectly suited for travellers on a budget like myself. Three student backpackers were able to lodge here for Â£65 per night for the triple room, on par with youth-hostel prices. The hotel was clean, if a bit old, shabby and brown (wallpaper, carpet, everything was brown!) That said, the shower was very good and powerful, there was a safe in the room and everything worked. Didn't have any noise problems apart from the 5am call to prayer, but that's just part of being in Istanbul.
