Breakfast was nothing special, but served its purpose - there was cereal and the usual fruit/meats/cheese/bread. The staff weren't overly friendly, but did get up early to check us out in time for our very early flight. The hotel itself was very well positioned in the old quarter, close to the Bayezid tram stop. However, it was quite hard to find (if you find the HSBC opposite the tramstop, it is behind, on the other side of the block). Our main complaint was that everywhere in the hotel reeked of smoke. However, I think this would be normal in any lower-budget hotel in Turkey. Overall, it was adequate for what we wanted: a cheap, clean, comfortable-ish place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel for travelers near the centrum of the city”
Reviews.Author: JirkaS
Reviews.Content: We use the hotel every time when we are in Istanbul. Usually good breakfast and services. Good availability to the centrum of the city. I appreciate very clean rooms on the 6 floor with Marmara sea view. But the price is higher and transport from the airport is free for one way only than last years. So what to say? Ideal choice for accomodation in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a budget priced holiday in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TimWh
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere not too pricey good for a young child (out daughter is 5) and close to the main sites of Istanbul. This hotel is in the garment district between the Bazzar (5 minutes walk away) and the restaurants of Kumcapi; it's a business area and the hotel's guests were a mix of tourists from both west and east and business travellers. The pickup at the airport went well and the busy staff were friendly and helpful throughout. The room was small but clean and everything worked well. I've stayed in a few Turkish hotels and breakfasts are often not up too much....as other people have written here the Inter does a great breakfast which varies from day to day and keeps you on your feet till it's time for a late lunch. The area falls quiet in the evening so it's good for children; there were quite a few families staying there. If you're looking for luxury and a scenic location then look elsewhere because there's plenty of both in Istanbul, but if you're looking for a straightforward, efficient decent place at a good price you couldn't do better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money? This is the 1 to beat!”
Reviews.Author: boxingandpopmusic
Reviews.Content: Initially planned for 2 days stay as I was planning to stay in Bursa and Edirne, but ended up visiting those 2 places on a daytrip and decided to stay in Istanbul for 8 days in full at Inter Hotel Istanbul from April 17 â€“ 25. The hotelâ€™s street is just perfect for me, located at the back of Barcelo Saray Hotel, away from the tourist crowd (and touts) down the road at Sultanahmet but nonetheless only few minutes walk. I checked on other hotels around Sultanahmet before ending up with Hotel Inter and realized that I could not find any better value than this. Itâ€™s maybe away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, but the tram station is a couple of minute walk that could whisk you to there in 2 minutes. Most tourists are always talking about Sultanahmet but just on the other side of the main road from the hotel (Hotel Inter is tucked in a quiet street few meters from the main tram road) are some of the best historical sites which are just at the back of the Grand Bazaar (again, the bazaar is only 3 minutes walk from the hotel) are two magnificent mosques â€“ Suleymaniyah and Beyazid mosques, the University of Istanbul grounds and if you continue on walking are local bazaars where you could watch the real Istanbulites doing their daily activities less of those touristic stuff and continue on strolling and youâ€™ll wind up at the Spice or Egyptian bazaar and the pigeon-full Yeni Camii or the beautiful New Mosque and fronting it is the Eminonu ferry port and the Galata Bridge that you could cross all the way to Galata tower. Took me about an hour or so to see great sites along the way from the hotel to the Galata Bridge but it was a pleasant stroll starting from the Grand Bazaar. Daily breakfasts included and fulfilling, coffee, tea juice, omelet and scrambled eggs, sausages, cheeses, butter, jams, bread, sliced oranges, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, cereals, and other stuff, that sometimes changes each day. Room size is just enough, double bed draped with clean-smelling white sheet and blanket with comfortable white pillows, a desk and chair, a small fridge, a nice small sofa that could be pulled into a lazy lounge ( I liked that!), TV with English news and other programs, dresser with an electronic safety deposit box which I did not even use. I felt secure with leaving my stuff around the room because when I left my newly bought iphone and my blackberry on top of the night table on my second day, I came back in the evening and found my room made up and both of the gadgets are exactly where I left it. I go home everynight on a clean bed and secure place. Internet connections on all floors are excellent, fast using my iphone, and it's free. Bathroom is dazzlingly clean with a hot shower stall, daily fresh-as-spring towels, liquid soaps, daily replenished tissues, hairdryer, everything works fine. The hotel staff are warm and efficient, the reception guys are welcoming and most helpful, the breakfast attendants are keen on cleaning the tables. The staff wonâ€™t try to be hotel-friendly with you â€“ theyâ€™re at your service! and the best part theyâ€™ll take you back to the airport for free! But your booking has to be 3 nights or more. Euro45/night for a single discounted if you pay cash. On my third night when I'm advised them that I will checkout because I'm supposed to be in Bursa, but I decided to return to Istanbul. I came back almost in the evening and still found my stuff in my room. There are toddlers and infants on the breakfast salon so must be good for family. Along the way to the hotel there are some street merchants selling clothes but never bothersome compared to some touts â€“ carpet sellers and restaurants around sultanahmet who greets people when passing by there everyday in different languages followed by a question of where you came from, and so on. There is also a restaurant few meters from the hotel and a lokantasi on the main road just in front of the Beyazid tram station near the hotel called Sar Lokantasi (local eatery that serves real Turkish fares at really affordable price, my meals of two varieties costs only about TL10). At the corner is Saray Bufe for a quick bite of sandwiches or doner kebab and on the other side of the road too beside the bazaar are several cheap eats too and the bus stops, a money changer, several atm machines and banks. The famous Koska turkish sweets store is on the main road - piece of advise: buy your sweets there instead of the airport, it's a lot cheaper. If youâ€™re planning to travel to Bursa, walk down the road to the seaside about 12 minutes and thereâ€™s the Yenikapi ferry port for those fast and comfortable catamaran ferries that travels to Yalova (70 minutes) or Guzelyali/Bursa (an hour and a half) to your way to Bursa and Iznik. In this class, facilities, location and price, this hotel is the one to beat, canâ€™t find any better. Would I recommend it? Yesâ€¦..on second thoughtâ€¦. definitely yes!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean hotel. Near to attractions but not a nice area”
Reviews.Author: PreciousLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter is located very close to the Grand Bazaar, probably only a 5 minute walk. It is a 15 minute walk from Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is situated in quite a grotty looking road, full of rubbish and groups of young men hanging around outside the numerous local shops. Although it is close to the Grand Bazaar it feels like you're quite out of the main touristy area where a lot of other hotels are situated. We moved hotels after 2 nights and went to stay at Hotel Sumengen which was absolutely lovely and only slightly more expensive. This was much closer to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia in Sultanahmet in a better area - there are a lot of other similar boutique hotels and nice restaurants surrounding it. The rooms at Inter Hotel are very small - not big enough for a couple to stay there comfortably for more than 1 night. There is only space for one bedside table and a very small wardrobe and desk. The bathroom is also tiny. There was only a sheet and blanket on the bed so we felt quite cold at night. A plus is that the bedroom and bathroom were both very clean. Overall this hotel has very small rooms and is in a poor location, it is a budget 2*. It was a depressing place to stay in a fab city so i would not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “It was just right”
Reviews.Author: TeamUnch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference in another part of Istanbul based on the reviews here and was happy with my choice! Great location, helpful staff, very punctual and friendly airport transfers, and excellent price! It is worth noting that from the descriptions on here, it sounds as though this place is located right across from the Grand Bazaar gates. As a female travelling alone for work I was a bit concerned about whether this would mean I would be hassled in the evenings from sellers or those hanging around looking for "targets". The hotel is actually across a main street and then down a side street and around a corner - so it was tucked into a quiet and safe nook in the city and I felt extremely comfortable coming and going in the early morning and late evening hours. Breakfast was good, although it does not change too much each day so by the end of 10 days I was a bit bored - but I think that is likely true of any hotel after 10 days. The rooms were always clean. To be clear- do not expect to be wowed by the luxury. These are simple and very small rooms (at least the singles were) but they had everything I needed and my room felt like a cosy "home" for the week and a half! One reviewer on here complained about people out on the street unpacking textiles and people hanging out in the lobby. Personally, I liked learning about where the textiles were going (local seamster in building across the street) as I sometimes find learning about daily life for the locals more interesting than just tourist attractions. Also, I liked that guests were comfortable hanging out together in the lobby to watch evening news or sports and I think it added to the spirit of the place. If you like that too- then this is likely more your kind of place. The best part of the hotel is definitely the owners and staff who were endlessly willing to help out - with recommendations for restaurants, attractions, setting up my internet in my room, and helping me figure out the logistics of getting to and from the conference I was attending. *Other tips: down the hill from the hotel is the Kumkapi area known for its twinkling lights and seafood restaurants. A nice evening walk, but the food was fairly standard and was even more expensive then some tourist traps, and not with the same level of service. A kebap type restaurant on the 2nd floor of a building right across from the hotel on the main side street (mithat casa cad) served fantastic food for a really great price. Also, Amedro's has great reviews on trip advisor and is about a 10 min walk from the hotel - definitely the best food I had while in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place, warm people”
Reviews.Author: ehsan-aj
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 11 nights. Very warm, welcoming and friendly people. We were four family members for eight nights and then three for nights after, but they did not change our family room and we paid as triple room. Also we had an extra transfer service for my sister who left soon. It was such a kind attitude. You just step out of hotel and there is the tram station. It is near enough to main street, and does not need long walking to get there. We all appreciate the efforts of being so nice and helping and wish you all the best guys. Sure we will be there for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old City location, rates, security & cleaniness”
Reviews.Author: DoinLittle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inter for me, fit my bill. Very clean and secure accommodation, well staffed, friendly and helpful people serving a robust hot breakfast, all at a reasonable price. It is also a hotel very centrally located, minutes to the Tram stop and Grand Bazaar yet easy walking distance (10 - 15 minutes) to all the old city attractions and many restaurants. Tip - they added a 6th floor so if you want the quietest location and a view of the Sea try booking rooms 601, 602 or 603.

Reviews.Title: “Satify...”
Reviews.Author: cedar57
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot for good behaviour,good services... Thanks for everything I am sure in the next trips i choose only Inter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ä±ntroductÄ±on to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Flipwin
Reviews.Content: All the good thÄ±ngs we heard about the Inter Hotel though TrÄ±p AdvÄ±sors turned out to be true. We were met on time at the airport and then recieved an unexpected free ride back after only a four night stay. As first timers to the city we found the location very interesting and handy. The nearby bazaar and University districts kept us busy at first. Then an easy 20 minute walk on a safe pleasant stree to the Blue Mosque wÄ±th all its suroundÄ±ng sights and excitement. Or only 5 minutes by tram all the way to the Galata BrÄ±dge with Ä±ts ferries etc. The hotel breakfast is good wÄ±th plenty of variety in fresh new and interesting morning treats. The rooms are small and basic but clean. Ours on the sixth floor seemed to be freshly refurbished. The staff was helpful wÄ±th all our typical newcomer requests for informatÄ±on etc. We wÄ±ll definately put the inter on the top of our list for hotels when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I would not pick this hotel if I had a second chance”
Reviews.Author: UKMMmm
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose this hotel because of the highly rated reviews provided in the earlier posts, but frankly I so regret that we have made such decision. To be fair, it was reasonably cheap especially you'd get 10% discount if paid by cash upon arrival, plus one way of free airport-hote / hotel-airport shuttle service. I'm honestly not a picky person, rule of thumb is to select a hotel that has a good location within the budget. Hotel facilities / restaurants never added any value in my decision making. However a few bad things that really made me not enjoying my 4 nights stay at this hotel: 1. Location - it's not as close as people described in terms of proximity to the Blue Mosque / Aya Sofia. It's about 20 mins easy pace walk. Although it is just opposite to the Grand Bazaar - but that's it. 2. Neighbourhood - Since it's close to the Grand Bazaar, people hang around that area tends to be a little poor (sorry to use such word), but I did see many beggers - including children beggers on the street. Btw, one of the children beggers actually spat on us when we walke back to the hotel one night around 8pm-ish unbelievable rude!! 3. The hotel - The nearby shops used the front of thet hotel and the hotel staircase to load / unload stuff to their lorries / shops, as well as there were some people always hanging around in the hotel lobby watching TV - I personally found that very dogey... 4. Cleaniness - The cleaners didn't do the job right - we returned to the room after the room has been tidied on the first day, we could smell someone has been smoking in our room. The day after that, the room was left with a very unpleasant smell coming from the toilet in the last 2 days of our stay, despite the cleaners have cleaned the room already. 5. Other little things - breakfast was below average, air con didn't work at all, the cup for brushing teeth was plastic (just not hygenic), staff wasn't particularly friendly... Overall, if you are not tight in budget, go for others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: torosworld
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and location, very kind staff. I advise the others.

Reviews.Title: “Best among all hotels near Aya Sofia, Blue mosque and Grand Bazar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 10 days for the second time and will definetely be back again! Apart from hotels excellent location ( it's near all sightseeing places ) the rooms were cozy and staff friendly and ready to help me with connecting my laptop to the wireless internet, to give me advice where to go and which trasport to catch. Beside fluent English and Turkish they speak all ex-Yu languages ( Serbian, Croatian, Macedonian, Bosnian ) so it is very convinient for people from these countries to stay there. Room service was quick ( beverages only ) , towels changed daily and room and bathroom kept perfectly clean -spotless!!! Definetely coming back here when I come back to Istanbul for some leather jackets shopping :) and this time bringing friends as well ! Miljana Jovanovic

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTDI
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented 2 family rooms at Hotel Inter for 10 days and ew really liked it. The hotel is very clean, very convinient and walking distance to a lot of attraction like Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Spice Market . A lot of good and reasonably price restaurant near by too so it make it easier for us to to have dinner. the hotel staff are very helpful. I also liked the free airport transfer . It make it a lot easier during our arrival and return. The staff are also very helpful overall.The room are quite clean too . The family room is actually quite big and can easily accomodate our 4 children and 2 single bed and 1 queen bed. Value for money .. Overall great experience and we will definetely come back to this hotel when visiting Istanbul..

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying place”
Reviews.Author: gmit
Reviews.Content: Good things: - cheap - great location - very, very clean - great airport pickup service - friendly staff Not so good things: - rooms are very small - breakfast is simple and boring All in all, if we'll go again in Istanbul, we will most probably repeat the stay in Hotel Inter.

Reviews.Title: “I will come here again!”
Reviews.Author: choc_o_ladno
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Inter twice: first with my friends in the triple room and than with my mother in the double. Advantages are obvious: - great location right in the center of historical area - most of the tourists attractions are 5 - 15 minutes walk. - free pickup at the airport (for at least 3 nights stay) - comfortable rooms with mini fride, hairdryer, air condition, TV with Turkish/English/German channels - nice buffet breakfast - very reasonable price with discounts for low season But what I like most of all about this hotel is that I feel here at home!!! And for this great thanks to the hotel staff - friendly, hospitable, willing to help, with individual approach to each guest!!! For sure I will come here again!

Reviews.Title: “gave us everything we asked for...”
Reviews.Author: 05toes
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed 3 weeks there. do we need to add more..? of course you might find better somewhere but more expensive, but you will for sure find lot worst at same price The hotel is very well located , close to grand Bazaar and blue mosque but also seashore where we could go for a run the staff was very friendly and gave us on 6 floor a room with view on the Bosphorus at a attractive price so I will be back there when back to Isatnbul

Reviews.Title: “Good Reliable and Clean Hotel Near The Grand Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Traveller_08
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Hotel Inter and found it to be a quiet hotel located on a back street near the Grand Bazaar and its tram stop. The hotel was clean, staff were friendly and the breakfast was simple yet sufficient. Would recommend, particularly for those who want to spend time in and out of the Grand Bazaar, otherwise everything is a short tram journey away. Have fun in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnichonaill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Inter Istanbul in September 08 and found it great vaule for money. It's very close to the bazaar and a short walk from Sultanahmet where the main tourist sights are. The staff were helpful and the free airport pick up (if you stay 3+ nights) was great, even though it's relatively easy to get to by metro and tram as well. Rooms were comfortable, buffet breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Symich
Reviews.Content: A great place at a reasonable price! Located just in the center - 2 minutes walk from Grand Bazar and 7 minutes walk from Aya Sophia and Sultanahmet, though very quiet! Room - clean and spacious, equipped with safe, fridge and TV with european channels. Fresh towels and linen every day. Breakfast - nice and abundant which allowed us to walk for a long time without feeling hungry! Staff - very friendly and helpful. The free pickup at the airport (for a 3 nights stay) is a big advantage as well. I recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to stay in the center of Istanbul, comfortably and inexpensively. I stayed this hotel twice (last year and this).

Reviews.Title: “Very reliable”
Reviews.Author: Fortaleza_7
Reviews.Content: Very nice place close to the Grand Bazar, yet very quiet. Room was extremelly clean and personel always willing to help. Breakfast was above average and airport pick-up service exceptional. For what they charge a night, a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: arnjoh
Reviews.Content: On our family trip to Istanbul in our autumn holiday, we really enjoyed the stay at Hotel Inter. We found it centrally located, close to the Grand Bazar and a short walk to the main tourist necessities of Istanbul. Also close to tram and bus station to further explorations, but a block from the noise of the heavy traffic on the main road. The rooms were clean, with air condition and modern bathrooms. There was also a TV-set, though we never used it - Istanbul certainly have other means of entertainment! Though we usually enjoyed our tea or glass of wine in one of the many cafÃ©Â´s round the city, the hotel offers a small bar in the vestibule. Breakfast was good and the staff friendly and helpful. Internet access was provided and we were able to check in our flights back home online. And we certainly valued the free pickup and drop-off to the airport! WeÂ´ll meet again - we know where, donÂ´t know whenâ€¦ Greetings from Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Best price in town”
Reviews.Author: Puerto_Rico_visitor
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Inter. Have visited Istanbul several times in these last 2 years. Since my first visit, I was very impressed with the hotel. Quiet street and close to main historical attractions. The room was impeccably clean, and with simple, recently renovated facilities. Small, but excellent bathroom. Have read other reviews where clients critized the breakfast offered at the Inter. I must say that it is excellent. Very good variety of food, unlike other hotels where breakfast is only comprised of a cold buffet. Definitely will stay at the Inter again when back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VickiL_8
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific place for a budget traveller to Istanbul. My room was very comfortable and really clean. The bathroom was especially good. I had TV including BBC and CNN. The breakfast which is included was buffet style, generous and really nice. I was especially impressed by the great location near the Grand Bazaar and a very short walk to the trams which made travel around the city really easy. But the very best thing was the excellent service from the friendly staff. They were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. I spent a week at the Inter and highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay. Comfortable and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Itisasmallworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice and it offers a good relation price-quality. It's near the Grand Bazar. Although not in a main road, I found the location quite good since we could go walking to Sultanhamed within 10 minutes approx. The staff was very friendly. They were very helpful even before we arrived, since we booked the room 8 months in advance and the kept answering questions we asked them by email. The room was just average for a 3 star hotel. It was comfortable, though not very big. The bathroom was very clean and new. The room was cleaned and the towels changed everyday. I cannot say breakfast was the best we could have, but I could always find something to eat. There was te, juice, milk, coffee, cereals, watermelon, toasts, jam, eggs, ham and sometimes there was a kind of bread with cheese. Apart from this there was not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful city centre location”
Reviews.Author: screeennameFrance
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel. Airport pickup went like clockwork at 2 in the morning. Pleasant sunny room with sea view over the rooves. Very good quiet aircon, unfortunately set a little on the cold side. Breakfast the same each day but a good selection allowed one to vary every day. Cleaning unobtrusive as long as you hand in key on leaving each morning. Good electronic safe and fridge nice additions since last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Comfortable, Helpful Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: pointgreyeric
Reviews.Content: Five friends and I stayed here for four nights and were very satisfied with our stay. The concierge was helpful in getting us Istanbul taxis that wouldn't rip us off (which is a lesson I learned the hard way), the location is great - right by the centuries old market, and the price was reasonable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location,”
Reviews.Author: lemon_ho
Reviews.Content: Positives - Central location: 5 min walk to tram stop and Grand Bazaar - Friendly receptionist - Free internet in the lobby (but not really broadband internet) - English TV channels (BBC & CNN) - A save available in the room Negatives - Breakfast: lack of variety and same food every day

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EdwinDelgado
Reviews.Content: Although it's not cheap, not at least for this Peruvian, the location, service and cleanliness make it worth.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: lschilde
Reviews.Content: Excellent money/value hotel, breakfast included. Location is great just opposite of Grand Bazar in quite street, good for tourist who want to stay close to everything. If you are one of us, looking for a cheap stay, and you look for very clean and secure hotel/hostel this is a great choice. Rooms are comfortable, especially those on 6th floor. The only minus is that you have only one way transfer, if you choose airport pickup as we did, you have to pay for transfer to the airport, but fortunately this is not a big problem while they have pretty cheap taxi's there in Istanbul :-). All in all, really worth every cent. Great job guys. Greetings from Croatia.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: SummerTravel3
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay. Two guys picked us up from the airport (at no charge!). They spoke NO English. But that's ok; adds to the adventure. The guys at the front desk were as helpful as they could be with only a few language miscommunications. Room was small with no carpet, but we are budget travelers and half expected that. A/C worked great Unfortunately, Turks smoke much. The free internet computer was in the lobby/bar/TV area which was usually puffing with smoke most evenings. The tomatoes and cucumbers on the breakfast buffet was new to us but we then saw them the entire time we were in Turkey. There was enough variety and quantity of food each morning that we did not starve. In fact, this was probably our best morning buffet of our 14-day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hugoyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in the hotel and had a great experience in Istanbul, it's a beautiful city. We thought the hotel was very good and both the pictures and the descriptions on the website are very accurate. The breakfast is the same everyday but it's possible to make different combinations and there is abundance, you can really eat as much as you want and they are not fussy about the time, many times we came down to eat just before 10am and there was still plenty to eat. The rooms are small but clean and the bathroom is spotless (we stayed on the 5th floor). We walked to all the main attractions from the hotel (Grand Bazaar, Haggia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topikapi Palace, Otto Park and even to the sea side to get a ferry for the asian side). Latif is definitely a great guy at the hotel. Always helpful and friendly, and will help you with any questions you may have. The only draw back in the hotel is the smoking in the lounge. BUT, it seems to me that most people in Istanbul smoke and the smell of smoke was everywhere in the city. Sometimes we felt the smell upstairs in our room but it wasn't unbearable. We never sat in the lounge so it didn't really bother us. The internet facility is also great and worked superbly on our laptop in our room. We were delighted to have someone picking us up at the airport and the guy who came for us was extremely friendly, giving us a very good first impression of both Turks and of the hotel staff. We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be near the main tourist areas in Istanbul. We will surely stay there if we come back to Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: random_walk
Reviews.Content: I'll second the good opinion for this hotel. The free airport pick-up was reassuring for my first visit to Turkey. It's a block off the main street with the trams which makes it quieter but but just two blocks to the Bezayit tram station for easy access to all of Istanbul with an Akbil pass. This pass works on the buses, trains, and ferries also. The Inter Hotel has excellent free WiFi with several access points so the signal is strong in your room, not just the lobby. There is also a free computer to use in the lobby. The rooms are small but kept very clean and the the shower in a tube is neat. This is a bargain with the free breakfast and 10% cash discount.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - but rude and unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrDBP
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at in Turkey and our first impression of the room wasn't great, but now that we can compare it to others throughout Turkey in this price range we know that it's actually pretty good. The rooms here are very small but they're clean and the bathroom is nice. Location is excellent, only a block back from the Grand Bazaar and tram station. Other points to note: With the exeption of the guy that works on the reception desk on Sundays - who was very nice, the other staff are unfriendly and not at all willing to assist. The guy (the manager?) with the glasses who worked throughout the week was particularly rude and unwelcoming. The buffet breakfast is excellent. The exchange rates offered by reception are surprisingly good for a hotel (although you'll get better rates up by the Grand Bazaar). The pick-up service from the airport is good and the price is reasonable. Book directly and pay in cash and you'll get a good room rate. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jbird1277
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of May 2008. My husband and I were looking for a budget hotel, close to the sites, and we booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. First with booking the room. I contacted the hotel through their website and continued coorespondence via email. All coorespondence were timely and friendly. We arrived in Istanbul around noon from the overnight train from Thessaloniki. (Note: The free transportation is only for the airport, NOT the train station.) However, there is a tram station right in front of the train station, and we took it to Beyazit stop, which is only a few blocks from the hotel. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but the hotel stored our bags while we went to get some lunch nearby. Although we had requested a room with a view, there was not a 6th floor room available when we arrived. So, we got a room on the second floor for the first night, and moved to the 6th floor for the next 2 nights. The 2nd floor room was adequate for a budget room but not what we were expecting based on the raving reviews on the site. (After being moved to our 6th floor room, we assume that most of the reviews are from people staying on the top floor.) Our 2nd floor room had 2 twin beds, a small closet, a small tv. There was a view of only a concrete wall from the window. It was a very small room, but adequate to just drop your bags in and sleep at night, which is really all you will be doing at a hotel in Istanbul! The 6th floor room was much better. It had a view of the sea over the rooftops. This room was much bigger, newer, and nicer. It had hardwood floors, more closet space, a small refridgerator, a double bed and a twin bed, and a much more updated bathroom with a haridryer. Thank goodness we changed rooms! We were much happier! The breakfast was good... with an assortment of meats, olives, cheeses, cucumber, fried eggs, bread, cereal, juices, and coffee. It was a good start to the day. Location- very close to the major sites... across from the Grand Bazaar and Istanbul University, within walking distance (or a couple of tram stops) from Hagia Sophia, Sultan Ahmet Mosque, Basillica Cistern. The staff held our bags for us on the day of checkout so we could see more of the city before catching our train back to Greece. Overall, this is a good choice for a budget hotel. Just be aware that there is a big difference between the top floor rooms and the other rooms, so you won't be surprised! We would definately stay here again, and hope to return to this beautiful city soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel Inter for 7 nights with girlfriend. Very clean. Sheets were changed 2-3 times during our stay.. Towels every day. We had a room on 6th floor.. Had a sea view, fridge, air-conditioning, small security safe, TV with 50+channels(inc. NBAtv :-D) Stuff is very friendly. Some of them are from Balkan, so you can even speak on your language if you come from area of former Yugoslavia.. Located just outside of main tourist area.. Walking distance from Grand Bazar.. Two tram stations from SultanAhmet(Blue Mosque, Taksim, AyaSofia,..) Bus station is very near, too, if you want to go to Taksim(european-like part, good for going out at nights). Just take bug 61B and go to last station.. Tip: use AKBIL(deposit 6YTL) and charge it with credit so you can use any city transportation for privileged prices..

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: IgelEye
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve just come back to Cologne, Germany, having stayed at the Hotel Inter for three nights. The hotel has everything we require of a budget hotel (weÂ´re not five-star people). We cannot fault the cleanliness or the service. The breakfast was more than adequate. The bar prices are also very reasonable. The staff have had to take some flak in some of the reviews, but everyone was very kind and helpful to us. I Â´m aware that particularly Americans expect a cheesy grin everywhere they go, but they should accept that few cultures in Europe can deliver on this. The location, in a quiet side street, is very convenient for the typical tourist sites ( donÂ´t forget to turn left out of the hotel) We walked everywhere, didnÂ´t even use the tram, but you can buy a token/jeton for â‚¬1.30 and get off where you like. Our room, 603, offers a sea view. The air conditioning was necesssary, even in May. The pick-up from AtatÃ¼rk Airport, which is free of charge if you stay at least three nights, worked out very well. We even got a free ride back to the airport as the driver was going there anyway to pick up some new arrivals. The only possible downside which might occur is that in the building opposite a chimney belches out black smoke for about three to four hours in the evenings. We think itÂ´s for the hot water system. Fortunately for us, the wind was blowing towards the sea, away from the hotel. However, should the wind turn, youÂ´d better make sure that all your windows remain tightly shut. I feel this should not put you off staying at the Inter. I thoroghly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Palmetto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location for the budget minded tourist. We were in a group of 10 and required 5 rooms. Part of our group had flight delays and did not arrive until after midnight. The hotel staff was friendly, efficient and helpful. They passed along email messages to our group letting them know that we were delayed in Paris and would be arriving very late. The rooms were clean, although a bit spartan. The bathrooms were marble and very nice with a great shower. Our stay was brief, but the hotel fit our needs perfectly. The breakfast was exceptionally good. And the free internet in the lobby was a great way to send emails back home. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice clean hotel at a reasonable price. I just wish that we had more time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: Gary2920
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic and straight forward with new bathrooms and a fresh breakfast, all good. However, the staff was of ZERO help when asked for local tips. BE AWARE, if your flying out of Ataturk Airport early before the LRT opens, this hotel is not in range of the inexpensive airport shuttle bus ($9). You'll have to take a cab for $30, which makes this a much more expensive hotel stay. Better options for tourists are closer to Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Ahlum
Reviews.Content: Picked up by hotel staff at Ataturk Airport. Our driver was courteous and patient although our flight from London was an hour late. Stayed in hotel for nine nights. We were given a room on the second floor with a view of the inner street for the first three nights. As requested, we got moved to another room with a view of Sea of Marmara on the sixth floor for the rest of our stay. Noise is minimal during the day. Very quiet at night. Room space is adequate with a single bed and a double bed. There is TV with 50 channels including the English BBC World, Prime and CNN. Individual air-conditioner in the room is useful when needed. Bathroom is exceptionally clean. Breakfast is served in the basement. It is a buffet with tea, coffee, juices (3 kinds), cereal, bread (3 kinds), sausages (2 kinds), sliced meat, eggs (2 kinds), cheese (2 kinds), tomatoes, cucumber, olives (2 kinds), jam and cheese spread. We had Turkish pastries for breakfast at a cafe nearby since we slept in for two mornings. Comparatively, breakfast in hotel is excellent. There is free internet access and bar service for tea or coffee in the lobby. Location of the hotel is excellent. It is just one small block from the bustling main street where there are many shops and restaurants. The Beyazit tram station is closeby. Across that street is the Grand Bazaar and the Beyazit Mosque. Beside the mosque is the Beyazit square where I love to relax in the late afternoon either in an open cafe or simply in a bench after a day's tiring tour before returning to the hotel. There is also a bus terminal nearby. Thanks to one of the hotel staff, we were told to take a bus (61B) which travels between Beyazit and Takism. Because this bus route is terminal to terminal, we went to Takism (the main shopping, dinning and nightlife area) twice by bus without any concerns about where to get off the bus. It is about 15 minutes walk or two tram stations from the hotel to the Sultanahmet area. All the staff members we met were friendly, helpful and very handsome. For location and value accommodation in Istanbul, I highly recommended the Hotel Inter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: scbtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights in mid March. The rooms were clean and comfortable, free internet access in the lobby and a tasty breakfast in the morning. Great location in the old city. Right near the Grand Bazaar, and walking distance to Haggia Sophia and the Blue Mosque.The only issue we had was the cigarette smoke from the lobby constantly drifted into our room. We had to put a damp towel under the door. For 35 Euro's per night - it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SVNP
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at this hotel on two occasions for a total of 8 nights, in Dec07 and Feb08. First of all, pls make use of the airport transfer service that is complimentary for longer staying guests. Gives you a hassle-free arrival especially if you have had a long flight. AtatÃ¼rk airport is manageable and modern, in fact it is a better stopover place compared to many outdated Southern European airports. Hotel itself is rather basic. That said, it fills the purpose extremely well, location is superb, close to everything but not directly on the main road. Do ask for rooms with a view. The local feeling at Kumkapi is just a short walking distance away and many Istanbul's tourist attractions or local transport to those is nearby. I do not agree that the breakfast is basic. There is enough supply of everything (buffet style) and you can always vary your own menu. I should say the breakfast was the highlight of every morning. Water supply in shower is more than adequate and the hotel is well maintained, towels changed daily, etc. Although not everyone speaks good English, there is always someone who does in the reception. If asked on downsides in this hotel, I really can't recall any. Perhaps they should smile more often (but then again it is Turkey and we had just stayed 2 months in Asia). You can see a lot of the Turkish way of life, nearby the hotel and I suggest you walk towards the sea. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in room, nor a refrigerator - perhaps there should be bottled water supply for hot months. The inroom safe worked oddly. Other than that, I do not really have any suggestions - very functional rooms and great bathroom. All in all, I would rate this hotel as well above the average, around 3+ stars, and considering the room rates, it gives excellent value for money. The staff helpful, even bothered to return us a cable we left in room during our first stay. I do not think that you can have better experience anywhere else in Istanbul in this price category. You need to pay several times more if you want to have higher standard rooms elsewhere and then again I'm not sure if it is worth it. Because you might miss out on this nice hotel that has the advantage of being family-run. Wireless internet connection worked superbly well. Reservations were dealt with promptly. Contact the hotel directly through their webpage for reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Real pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: sunlight1970
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Especially our room with the sea view (N602) I would mark it all with very good as the room looked new, the facilities were very clean and convenient, the staff were kind and understanding. Breakfast (buffet) is more than enough and very tasty. I intend to come again and at the moment I have advised some of my friends not to hesitate to come and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishmolly101
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at this hotel for 2nights in Fenruary 2008. The hotel is in an excellent location for buses and trams should you wish to venture further a field. However Sultanamhet, home to top tourist attractions such as Ayasofia, Blue mosque, hippodrome, obelisk, yarebatan sarayi etc is literally a 10minute comfortable walk down a busy main street full of shops and beautiful sights. A futher 10minutes walk and your in Sirkici/Eminonu where fish kebabs, boat trips, views of the bhosphorus, galata kulesi etc are a plenty, not to mention the new mosque and the spice bazar. The grand bazar is a couple minutes walk from Hotel Inter. The hotel rooms were comfortable and the room was always warm and cosy. Nice breakfast which consisted of cooked eggs, sausages/salami, cheesey bread and normal bread, cereals, cheeses, meats, olives, yoghurts and a variety of spreads, teas/coffees juices. The rooms were cleaned everyday. Staff were polite and helpful. We would stay at this hotel again. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nebula333
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in hotel Inter for 6 nights. We are very satisfied. Room was comfortable and clean. Hotel is 10min walk from Aya Sofia, so you don't need to use tram. Stuff is very friendly, they helped us in lot of things (what to do, how to get here and there ...). Only thing that i would change is breakfast, you can eat all you can, but everyday is same. If you don't want to look at walls outside, ask for street side or 6th floor on other side (you can see Beyazit mosque). Lot of people in here talked about smell of the smoke, but for 7 days, we didn't smell that smoke at all. Overall rating is 4/5, it gives a lot for price you pay. If we come to Istanbul again, we will sure think about Inter again. Greetings from Belgrade

Reviews.Title: “It's good hotel”
Reviews.Author: psharma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Istanbul. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Rooms were clean, not very spaceious, but ok. Bathroom was clean. Breakfast was very normal not that great but I guess it's ok for this kind of hotel. I wish they could change the breakfast little bit every day. It get very boring to eat the same thing feel like eating the leftover from previous night. They provided free transportation from/to airport. Driver was very pleasant but the other staff including manager are very stone faced- no smile on the face, we didn't care but it makes a big difference in the morning when you are ready to go out. No body even say good morning or hello etc. I guess for the price we paid (40.5 Euro for cash PN) we could except all this. It is not in Sultanmut. It is 2 station away from Sultanmut. Tram system is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, delightful staff, excellent breakfast! what more can one ask”
Reviews.Author: cominhome
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed with you this december for five days and could not have been happier. Your rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet. Your staff was polite and helpful. Your breakfasts were grand; I loved having white cheese, olives and cucumbers for breakfast and my husband and our friends were happy with their eggs and meat and bread. Hot milk was a delight too. The IntelrHotel is centrally located and though we are all in our late 60's (oh all right, one of is 70!) we were able to walk easily to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi and of course, the tiny four blocks to the Grand Bazaar. With your staff's help, we managed to take the tram to the Egyptian Bazaar, took a boat ride up the Bosporous and climbed the Tower. Your driver picked us up at the airport and dropped us off at the airport therefore saving us money and trouble. What a wonderful service. We loved Istanbul and a good part of our love with your city was staying in your hotel. Thank you. We are sending all our friends to you.

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a decent budget hotel with good location. Inter offered it all. After reading reviews on tripadvisor I've requested rooms on the 6th floor. We had 2 rooms - one was smaller than the other, but both were very clean and exactly like the pictures on hotel's website. Front desk people were friendly and helpful. We had a'port pick-up and drop-off included in the price. The guy who pickd us up was a little late, but granted - we didn't have any checked-in luggage so we just walked out of the customs zone. I called to the hotel and they assured me that the driver was about 5-10 mins away and that was correct. Breakfast is very average, but it was fine. We had our cup of coffee and that was the most important thing :-). Location is great - it's right off the main street, we felt very secure, close to everything. We never once needed a taxi - we walked everywhere. Regarding smoking - anyone can smoke pretty much anywhere in Turkey, just accept it. I was pleasantly surprised that our floor/rooms didn't smell, even thought we had ashtrays in the rooms. Don't expect 5* resort property, but for the price and location, this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “It is OK”
Reviews.Author: nokia6198
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Hotel Inter. The accommodation is clean and cheap, near to the major attractions. The room was small but clean with a renovated bathroom. Airport pickup was included in the price. The only thing that disturbed us was the smell of the smoke everywhere in the hotel. When I read the comments I was expecting a more friendly hotel, but the price-value is good. Overall you get a good hotel on a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Sound hotel pity about the staff”
Reviews.Author: MadMaz7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Inter Istanbul 30th Oct - 2nd Nov. I booked directly via their website and received prompt and courteous replies. I requested a room on the top floor as I read in past reviews that there is a good sea view from the top floor and I was promised that my request would be given consideration. My request was honoured but the view is limited. The room and bathroom was small but very clean and there was a small flat screen TV. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. In general I cant fault this hotel, it is great value for money, locationwise it was spot on ( although it is on quite a steep side road from the main road where the tram stop is only metres away). The only thing negative about the Hotel Inter is the staff....what a miserable bunch!! The receptionist (I think his name was Latif) was particularly moody, he could hardly give us eye contact never mind ask us if our stay was ok or if everything was alright. He never took an interest in what we were going to do or where we were going. No pleasantries, no welcome, no nothing!! Either he is sick of tourists or he just could not be bothered! When the tea ran out in the breakfast room I asked one of the staff if I could have more tea, he rolled his eyes up (it was 9;45) and put more water in the tea urn, but never bothered to tell us that the tea was ready. Apart from the staff our stay there was good and would recommend it if you're not bothered about staff not being attentive or welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel Close to the Sights”
Reviews.Author: kate0614
Reviews.Content: The hotel Inter is a clean, cheap hotel walking distance from all the major sites. The furnishings are tacky and the rooms are small, but the sheets are bright and clean and the bathroom is new-ish and sparkling clean. Airport pickup was free and convenient. Staff very helpful, although not particularly friendly. Nothing about this hotel grossed me out, which is pretty good for such a low rate. Overall, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: History4300
Reviews.Content: Dear Hotel Inter I and my historystudents stayed at your hotel from October 8.th. to October 14.th. 2007. Our stay was a complete succes.Service was fine, the rooms OK - clean and cozy. Everything worked. The toilets were celan and worked. Cleaning was generally fine. Breakfast was exelent. The location of the hotel is real good, too. The hotel is situated in the centre og the city with only a short way to the big sights and at the same time it is located in a street with fairly no noice and only little trafic. All in all a fine hotel with fair prices. We can highly recommend Hotel Inter.. Jens Pietras, Historian, Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Appalache
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hotel Inter the third time now and I can only recommend this hotel in the heart of Istanbuls old town. First of all there is the very reasonable price, the rooms and bathrooms are clean, there is satellite tv (mostly turkish channels, 2 or 3 english like cnn and one german) and air condition. The hotel staff offers pick-up service from the airport but it can be easily reached by public transportation as well (from atatÃ¼rk a/p metro to aksaray then tram 3 stations to beyazit place or taxi abt. 10 Lira). From the hotel a lot of Istanbuls attractions are in walking distance 5-15 min.: The covered bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmed and Suleymaniye mosque. Abt. half an hour to walk to eminÃ¶nÃ¼, the harbour site. There is no fridge in the room but lots of small shops nearby where they offer food and drinks until midnight. Breakfast Buffet is international style with filtered coffee and eggs, breakfast room is no smoking meanwhile. Don't expect luxury or a good scenic view but it's clean, top-located and a very good choice for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dcn_nz
Reviews.Content: We accidentally stumbled across this hotel while searching for a place to stay in Istanbul for a week. And are we ever glad we did! We read the reviews that complained about the smoking (Hey - welcome to Europe!) but once inside the room, it wasn't that noticeable. And the rooms may not be large, but they are comfortable, with everything you need (including free wireless in the room!). And let's face it - you don't come to Istanbul to stay in your hotel room! The hotel was probably the best value for money we encountered on our long trek through Europe (on business, I must add). They have a free shuttle to and from the airport (even for our VERY early morning flight to Frankfurt), and that is an important extra. It is likely an essential element for any stay in Istanbul. The staff were friendly and helpful, the location is BRILLIANT, and the breakfasts were entirely adequate. There isn't a lot of variety and you aren't going to get a full-cooked English breakfast, but there are eggs and meat and cheese and rolls and coffee, so there isn't much room to complain, especially as the breakfast is included in the room rate. So we will be returning someday to explore Istanbul more fully, and we will be intending to stay here. Full marks!! Just a sidenote on location: The Hotel Inter Istanbul (not to be confused with another hotel of a similar name) is on a quiet sidestreet in the Beyazit district but is only minutes from the tram and the local bus station, which are immediately adjacent to the Grand Bazaar, and only about 15 minutes walk from Ayasofia, the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome. All in all, a great place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: littler78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Grand Bazaar & within walking distance to the tram, so it was soooo convenient for us. Also near many taxis so it is easy to get around. The staff was very friendly & helpful, eager to please. It's a basic hotel, really just a good place to crash, shower & have a nice breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, pity the staff rip tourists off”
Reviews.Author: jimbo_H_Pt
Reviews.Content: It's a pity a great hotel is brought down by the actions of a few. I stayed here in Sept 2007 and the hotel was great, modern rooms, good air-conditioning, clean and tidy, excellent bathroom and shower. But... and I'm afraid it's a big but, you have to be careful with your dealings with the staff. I arrived from the airport with nothing but big bills in my wallet, after the porter showed me to my room and explained all the features he hung around for a tip, I gave him a note and asked for change. After an hour I came to the realisation I was not going to get anything! I felt really stupid. When I checked out, I mentioned my experience to the manager, who just shrugged his shoulders as if it were of no consequence, I was astonded! I then got the feeling that this was not an isolated case. So please be very careful when tipping staff, you may find they suddenly lose any grasp of English. What a pity, because the hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Beyazit”
Reviews.Author: madanglian
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel which I would recommend highly. The only slight negatives were that access is via the steep and rather dirty Mithat PaÅŸa Caddesi, and that the lift only goes up to the 4th/5th floor (obviously only a problem if you are on the 6th floor) These are far outweighed by the positives, however. The staff were consistently polite and helpful - for example explaining the baffling system of daily passes/smart cards for the tram/metro system. All rooms were clean and well-maintained, and we were offered larger rooms when they became available, though our room was only slightly smaller than average. Some of the rooms have 17-inch LCD tvs - all rooms have a variety of local and foreign stations (cable?) The hotel is within a few minutes of the Grand Bazaar, and about 30 minutes walk from the major attractions of Sultanahmet - without charging Sultanahmet prices. Breakfast included cereals as well as the more traditional type of Turkish breakfast. There was even filter coffee, though not quite strong enough to my palate...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic, and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: trainaholic
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our honey moon in Turkey. We stayed at three hotels, two in Istanbul and one in Antlaya. Check my other reviews to see what we thought about the others. Inter was the first one. There was someone waiting for us in the airport. The greeted us really well and brought our heavy luggage up to the room. Five minutes after a guy came with a huge plate of chilled watermelon and honeydew as a welcome gift. The hotel is basic but it has everything you need. The bathrooms are really nice and clean. There were a few English channels. Beds were comfortable And breakfast was pleasant. Its located in a OK area. We had someone that took us all over so I donâ€™t know the walking distance to different parts of town. But everything is close. A walk to the water took about 20-30 mins. Istanbul University is about 7 mins away. We stayed and two higher end hotels in Turkey and I personally enjoyed my time the most at this one, which was the cheapest! 5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service hotel inter”
Reviews.Author: kcprema
Reviews.Content: my fren n i stayed in hotel inter for 2 days last month.tis cozy little hotel in the heart of the town was a very nice place 2 stay.it is near all d facilities and the staff were very very nice.they were very helpful n obliged to our every need. although they are a small hotel they are very clean n the staff are very friendly. they sent us off with a smile till the doorstep and made us feel very happy tht we chose to stay with them.and we might juz visit them again soon..... hotel inter , keep up ur good work

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: cpm0405
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Inter for 7 nights and overall the stay was above average. The hotel is well located just minutes away from the bus and tram stops, the Grand Bazaar and cheap but decent restaurants. The rooms were basic but clean with a decent sized bathroom and commendable views (We requested a room on the 6th floor due to advice on past reviews and would recommend that future visitors also try this). The staff were friendly enough, occasionally they smiled, however, other times they seemed completely oblivious to everything. The email replies to our booking enquiries were swift and efficient and the price was superb for the location of the hotel. They also offer a 10% discount on cash payments. The free airport transfer was great - it saved us about Â£10 each way in a private taxi and saved us from roaming the city of Istanbul at night! The breakfast was average with a small selection and definately wasn't the highlight of the holiday! Overall a great hotel for those on a budget and in need of a good location but for those with a slightly greater budget I would recommend looking around a little further and paying an extra 25% on accommodation to stay in a hotel with more character in Sultanahmet itself.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, quiet, good location & very cheap for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Nipikipi
Reviews.Content: we stayed 8 nights in hotel inter, were pleasantly surprised from the very start, ok smoke in the lobby as some wrote, but very clean rooms (changed towels every day, linens every 3), good breakfast with coffe/tea, cornflakes, milk, bread, cheese, olives, boerek, watermelon, etc, centrally located more or less opposite university, 5 mins walk to bus and tram station, 10-15 mins walk to hagia sofia and blue mosque, free internet in lobby, friendly staff, paid EUR 50 in cash per night for triple room, definitly worth the stay and would go back, i have seen a lot of hotels all over the world, this one is top 10 considering how much you get for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “only the best”
Reviews.Author: pk80
Reviews.Content: I was told that Turkish hospitality was number one in the world. Now I am able to confirm that - at least, in Hotel Inter Istanbul, this was the case. We stayed there for 5 nights from July 5 to July 10, 2007. The booking was made via internet, on the website of the Hotel, and everything - including the e-mail correspondece - worked smoothly. With the airport transfer both ways on the minute, a great buffet breakfast and an always friendly and helpful staff, this hotel is among the best ones I've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay in a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Inter Istanbul for a couple nights and had an average stay. Plus points of the hotel are the price and location, efficient email correspondence while booking and clean basic rooms with nice sized bathroom and good water pressure. However, we found the staff to be very hit or miss, either very friendly or very aloof. The breakfast has a decent selection but the staff barely said anything to us in the dining area. The lobby is VERY smoky so if you have issues with this, it would not be a good idea to stay here. If budget is your top priority this isn't a bad hotel, otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michal_waw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel 10 days. Everything was perfect. Room and whole hotel is very clean. We had 24h hot water, flat-screen TV in room with many sat-channels (also english), free wireless internet in room, which working good, individually controlled airconditioning, sound-proof windows (perfectly isolating from any noise from the street, especially morning and late-night muezin calling) and superb view of Marmara Sea. Staff is very nice and helpful. You can ask for everything and surely you get correct answer. Breakfast buffet is very good: choice of eggs, meat, fruits and local specialities. There's also bar and money exchange in hotel. Location also is very good: 2 minutes walk from bazar, 2 tram stops from Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi, 5 min by tram to Eminionu ferry-port. Hotel offers free airport pick-up and drop-off. Works perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Poppi_MB
Reviews.Content: It's very good value for money and well located. The rooms were clean and the shower was good. The only problem was the lack of ventilation in the breakfast room. People can smoke there (and everywhere else in Istanbul) and there were no windows or smoke extractor in the room, so it was like eating breakfast in an ashtray. I recommend this hotel for those who want to spend the day out enjoying the city and don't want to spend too much money on a flashy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: MariposaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, clean room , great location. Nice hotel, overall, considering the low price for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ROULOTTE
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. Helpfull and nice team there. Very convenient for business purpose.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Inter Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Mithatpasa Cad. Buyuk Haydar Efendi Sok. No: 29 | Beyazit, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
